Description:
Description

Ardelyx is focused on enhancing the way people with kidney and cardiovascular diseases are treated by developing innovative first-in-class medicines. Ardelyx’s pipeline includes tenapanor for the control of serum phosphorus in adult patients with CKD on dialysis, preparing for NDA filing mid-year, and RDX013, a potassium secretagogue program for the potential treatment of high potassium, or hyperkalemia, a problem among certain patients with kidney and/or heart disease. In addition, Ardelyx received FDA approval of IBSRELA (tenapanor) on September 12, 2019. Ardelyx has established agreements for tenapanor with Kyowa Kirin Corporation in Japan, Fosun Pharma in China and Knight Therapeutics in Canada for the development and commercialization of tenapanor in the respective territories.

VP, Information Technology



Ardelyx is seeking an experienced leader to oversee enterprise Information Technology (IT) strategy and vision and drive cross-functional IT needs in the role of VP, Information Technology. This role is a key leadership position that will interact with all levels of management. The right candidate will combine relevant experience both in the life sciences industry, preferably biotechnology and/or pharmaceuticals, and ideally with small to mid-sized public companies. The VP’s goal is to deliver an architecture that supports the most efficient IT environment meeting current needs while preparing for future growth and development. The role requires a hands-on, can do attitude and the ability to juggle IT requirements with the additional demands of a growing organization. The successful candidate will be well versed with industry trends and cutting-edge technologies and be responsible for the development and execution of the enterprise IT strategy, including IT governance, risk & compliance, technology due diligence and selection, project management, and service delivery models. Key to this role will be balancing the technical aspects of this position with the ability to integrate the company’s corporate strategy with IT priorities, taking operational, cybersecurity, data privacy and compliance risk into consideration, while balancing fiscal responsibility.






Experience in cyber securityston, MA or Fremont, CA) with domestic travel up to 25%.

As a member of the Ardelyx team, you will help us in developing and bringing to market first in class medicines to better the lives of underserved patients with cardiorenal diseases. It’s the patients in need that motivate and inspire us to be relentless and work hard every day. They push us to maintain a clear focus on scientific and clinical integrity with a commitment to medical innovation so that we can deliver exceptional medicines.

We are seeking the best in class scientists, advanced thinkers, and people who thrive on collaboration to co-create the future. You will be working with some of the industry's best scientists in a team environment focused on world class research. Ardelyx offers a competitive total rewards package, perks and an innovative and dynamic culture and research environment.

We change lives every day. Special Olympics Northern California & Nevada (Special Olympics) serves 25,000 Special Olympics athletes through health, fitness, education, sports training & competitions. Special Olympics is part of an inclusion movement that combines education, health, and community development services to children & adults with & without intellectual disabilities.
Industries: Health, Wellness and FitnessCivic & Social OrganizationNonprofit Organization Management

Description:
Who We Are

FWD.us is a bipartisan political organization that believes America's families, communities, and economy thrive when everyone has the opportunity to achieve their full potential. For too long, our broken immigration and criminal justice systems have locked too many people out from the American dream. Founded by leaders in the technology and business communities, we seek to grow and galvanize political support to break through partisan gridlock and achieve meaningful reforms. Together, we can move America forward.

The Director of Information Technology will be a member of the Community Department, whose mission is to build and engage the supporter base needed to effect policy change. The Director of Information Technology will report to the Head of Technology.

The Director of Information Technology will work with the Head of Technology to oversee and support the technical infrastructure of FWD.us. This includes tracking our technology in order to achieve goals, meet quotas, eliminate security risks, increase user satisfaction, and maintain operations and systems. The Director of Information Technology will build security-focused infrastructure, systems, and technology solutions and help to cultivate a culture of shared best practices and knowledge around FWD.us products and technologies.











We are an organization committed to making the world a better place for all people. Diversity is the source of our strength, and allows us to make better decisions, be more impactful, and be better at our jobs day to day. We see our internal commitment to diversity to be reflective of how we view the world and the changes we want to see become reality.

This company is an equal opportunity employer and does not unlawfully discriminate against employees or applications for employment on the basis of an individual's race, color, religion, creed, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status or any other status protected by applicable law. This policy applies to all terms, conditions and privileges of employment, including recruitment, hiring, placement, compensation, promotion, discipline and termination.

Whenever possible, the company makes reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities to the extent required by law. Applicants who would like to request a reasonable accommodation should contact Human Resources.

Description:
PLEASE NOTE THIS ROLE IS BASED IN SPOKANE, WA.

Are you looking to be part of an emerging software-as-a-service (SaaS) company, in one of the hottest spaces in the market?

*****Please note, this is not a job posting, it is for a free networking group to help you in your job search.*****

These are uncertain times and perhaps you've become caught up in the uncertainty. Here at Gateway, we're feeling the same uncertainty.

I have started a networking/career counselling group that will not only offer job hunting advice, but also additional free tools to bring your job hunt to another level as well as help you keep sane by staying engaged in the job search.

If you're interested in more information, please drop me a note and I'll give you a broad overview of the format.

By way of an introduction I'll send you a handbook on how you can improve your online appearance and resume. If you are interested, I can also run a behavioral report about you, that will help detail your personality, how you prefer to manage, and how you prefer to be managed. You can add this report to your job applications, and I'll show you how to use that behavioral report to your advantage.

I've also uploaded some case studies that are recordings of virtual meetings to show you how you can apply your behavioral report to give any potential employers far greater insights in to not only your skills and experiences but what makes you tick. I look forward to connecting with you.

Again, I stress, it's free. I'm hoping to develop my network by offering you something that you can use right now because, candidly, most of my clients can't use our services right now!

About Marvell

At Marvell, we believe that infrastructure powers progress. That execution is as essential as innovation. That better collaboration builds better technology. Trusted by the world’s leading technology companies for 25 years, we move, store, process and secure the world’s data with semiconductor solutions designed for our customers’ current needs and future ambitions. Through a process of deep collaboration and transparency, we’re ultimately changing the way tomorrow’s enterprise, cloud, automotive, and carrier architectures transform—for the better.

The data infrastructure that our customers build has never been more critical to our global economy. It’s what’s keeping the world connected, businesses running, and information flowing. If you’re ready to excel, innovate, and truly enjoy your work, apply now for the position detailed below.




Marvell is empowering the global data economy. Whether at the network core or edge, our leadership technologies make it possible for the world’s data to be processed, moved, stored and secured faster and more reliably. With leading intellectual property and deep system-level knowledge, Marvell's infrastructure semiconductor solutions are transforming the 5G, cloud, enterprise and automotive markets of tomorrow.

At Marvell, you’ll see your ideas put to work, share in the success of our company, and achieve a healthy life-work balance in a strong culture of corporate citizenship and global semiconductor leadership. If you are ready to excel, innovate, and truly enjoy where you work, apply now for the Lead Designer, Corporate Communications position and join Marvell’s growing Global Corporate Marketing and Communications organization.

The Role

The Information Security Director will be responsible for leading Marvell Security Operations team. Primarily, the Security Operations Director must ensure an appropriate, risk-based approach for Security Incident Response, Remediation and Recovery. This will be accomplished through the effective management of technical security operations staff, Implementations and maintenance of processes, and deployed security tools for detection, prevention and response.

This is an exciting opportunity to build the strategy, infrastructure and technology practices for a high impact non-profit. Special Olympics has a need for a clear, scalable IT strategy. This role designs, develops, maintains and enhances systems to improve operations and data cohesiveness, and to meet the current and future needs of the organization.

This role requires an individual who is comfortable being both a creative and “hands on” leader with a demonstrated track record in directing change management and identifying areas for process improvement, and a comfort with acting in a consultative technical support capacity on various technology initiatives cross-departmentally.

The successful candidate drives IT projects that align with the needs of the organization. In addition to technical acumen, the position requires strong analytical skills, a commitment to delivering quality solutions on time and on budget, excellent communication and collaboration skills, and a curiosity for new insights and opportunities. This role reports directly to our Chief Operating Officer.

Our ideal applicant is not just a technical expert, but someone who can dive in and understand what’s important about our program, operations, development and marketing efforts, and then drive technology initiatives that get results that matter.

We want to meet you if you want your day to include:



We are looking for someone who has the following qualifications:

Community Psychiatry is a leading provider of outpatient mental health services, focused on expanding access to high quality, compassionate care. We believe that by cultivating a community of caring professionals, we change lives for the better. And it’s not just our providers who are planting the seeds of change– each team member’s leadership and daily actions impact the lives of our patients and one another.

Job Description

The ideal candidate will interact with the Board of Directors, serves as a member of the management team and contributes to the development and implementation of agency strategies, policies and practices. The IT Director directly supervises the IT Department and other office staff as assigned, manages the IT network contractor.



Looking to make a difference? Our mission at Interim is to provide services and affordable housing to supporting members of our community with mental illness by building productive and satisfying lives in a world in which people with mental illness are able to live, work, learn and participate fully in the community. Join our team and instill hope in the community.



An exceptional benefit package including; Medical/Dental/Vision/403(b) retirement plan and Life Insurance. Offers competitive vacation and sick time.



To learn more about Interim and to apply for this position, please go to our website at http://www.interiminc.org/employment/.



Competitive Compensation; Exempt; 40 hours/week; Not Eligible for Overtime.



Executive Director.



Bachelor’s degree in business administration, information technology, finance, public health administration or related field. At least 5 years’ experience in general management positions, with a minimum of 3 years of supervisory experience; Excellent computer skills with proficiency in Microsoft Office programs; Experience providing overall direction to information technology staff and contractors, including networking, hardware, software and data management; Experience in development, installation and management of data networks (preferably including cloud computing solutions), data systems, and data analysis, including outcome measurement; Experience with data security, business continuation and disaster recovery management; Experience with evaluation, implementation and management of telecommunications systems including VOIP & cloud solutions); Experience with evaluation, implementation and management of surveillance systems; Experienced in negotiation with vendors, evaluation and purchasing or leasing of office equipment (such as MFP’s, mobile phones) and consideration of ergonomics in purchasing for workstations. Excellent and effective interpersonal skills and a collaborative management style; High comfort level working in diverse environment; Excellent communication skills both verbal and written. Ability to drive an automobile to travel to program sites and meetings, ability to see well enough to read data on a computer screen, ability to hear normal conversations and answer telephone, ability to communicate with other staff; hand, finger and body coordination sufficient to write clearly and to input data into a computer.

Knowledge of trends in local, state and federal policies and funding in the behavioral healthcare industry; experience with Electronic Medical Record Systems.

Valid California driver's license; auto in safe operating condition; auto liability insurance; good driving record; criminal record clearance; proof of authorization to work in the United States as required by Immigration and Reform Act of 1986. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.



Under the supervision of the Executive Director, the Information Technology Director will assist with the following duties:



Ability to: operate a motor vehicle; climb stairs; possess good communication skills; meet the requirements of the classification and have mobility, vision, hearing and dexterity levels appropriate to the duties to be performed. Capable of the following extended activities: standing, sitting, climbing stairs.

Capable of the following intermittent activities: lifting 25 pounds or more and bending in the performance of infrequently performed office duties.

Must be able to work on site several days/week in Monterey County.

Note: Interim does not cover relocation costs.

Description:
SVP Information Technology & Innovation (Information Technology)

SVP Information Technology & Innovation

FNBC Bank, with headquarters based in Ash Flat, Arkansas, has an immediate opening for a . This role requires someone with the ability to develop and implement a strategic vision of the information technology function for the bank. We are seeking someone that will push business boundaries, challenge long-held assumptions and look for cutting-edge technologies. Although our home office is located in Ash Flat, the primary base work location for this positon is flexible and may be based at any of our FNBC branch offices.

: FNBC Bank, chartered in 1912 as the Bank of Ash Flat, is a $560 million-asset community bank headquartered in Ash Flat, Arkansas. We are a progressive bank with a strategic emphasis on growth. Additional office locations include Cherokee Village, Highland, Hardy, Mammoth Spring, Salem, Melbourne, Horseshoe Bend, Batesville, Mountain Home and Jonesboro.

The SVP of Information Technology & Innovation will be responsible for establishing the overall IT vision and strategically developing the technical infrastructure, including on premise and cloud-based applications. An innovative thinker, the ideal candidate will continuously seek new and unique ways for FNBC to differentiate its customer delivery methods, as well as its core product and process platforms.







FNBC Bank is an equal opportunity employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, and local law. The Broad, a high-profile contemporary art museum founded by philanthropists Eli and Edythe Broad on Grand Avenue in downtown Los Angeles, seeks a forward-thinking, collaborative, and hands-on technology practitioner who will provide strategic vision, operational leadership, and support in maintaining and evolving all things information technology at one of the most innovative art museums in the country. The Director of Information Technology (Director) is responsible for supporting and maintaining The Broad’s integrated back-end business systems as well as its visitor-facing technology.

CERES GLOBAL GROUP

DIRECTOR OF INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY

Position Overview, Key Concepts

As a nimble, dynamic and diversified international specialty contractor, Ceres (pronounced 'series') is looking for a hands-on IT Director with a strong foundation in IT theory and fundamentals.

We seek an entrepreneurial, dynamic, diplomatic, and current IT problem solver who is experienced and adept at supporting an extensive deployed or "field" workforce.

Someone whose training covered: software integration/optimization, exposure to software development, systems and database management, MS business products, IT ethics and the relationship between people and technology.

We are looking for a strong, professional: with demonstrable thinking, writing, leadership and communication skills in addition to technical ability.

This individual will interview with evidence of sound judgement, initiative, flexibility, and detail orientation.They will be able to prove how their efforts consequentially and positively impacted their previous employers' organizational effectiveness, security, and productivity.

Information technology at Ceres is an investment and as such the IT Director must consider the ROI and necessary metrics on each project.

The Director of Information Technology is the highest-ranking IT position at Ceres reporting directly to the owner and founder of the organization.

KEY KNOWLEDGE, SKILL and ABILITY AREAS



KEY-DUTY PROGRESSION

Company Description

Associated Materials is the parent company for leading residential building product brands such as Alside, Gentek, Revere, Alpine and Preservation. With a legacy of over 70 years in business, we create, develop, manufacture, extrude and distribute beautiful siding, windows and more throughout our network of North American company-owned distributors.

Headquartered in Cuyahoga Falls, OH, Associated Materials has over 4000 employees across its U.S. and Canadian manufacturing footprint and our extensive North American distribution center network (120+ locations!). We are a charter member of the Vinyl Siding Institute, the American Association of Architects, the National Association of Home Builders, and the National Association of the Remodeling Industry.

This combination of established brand recognition, manufacturing capacity and distribution reach makes for an exciting and rewarding employment value proposition. Join us, and discover the next step in your career journey.



VP Information Technology (“VP IT”)



Headquartered in Cuyahoga Falls, OH, Associated Materials has over 4000 employees across its U.S. and Canadian distribution center network (120+ locations) and manufacturing operations (11 locations).



We are looking for an experienced VP IT to oversee the use of information technology in our company. The successful candidate will be the one to devise the company’s IT strategy and ensure that all systems necessary to support its operations and objectives are in place and maintained across the US/CA operations.

Our ideal VP IT must have a solid IT background and consistently keep up-to-date with advancements of the field. Furthermore the VP IT should have a diverse range of experience able to blend new technology along with homegrown systems. Finally this role must be a proven leader with strong strategic and business acumen.

The goal is to ensure that information technology adds the maximum value to our company so as to facilitate the success of our business.














Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Recruiters: Please note that Associated Materials, Alside and any of its affiliated companies does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or offers of recruiting service associated with any published or unpublished employment opportunities. Any unsolicited information sent to AMI or any of its employees will be considered as unencumbered and free from any fee or charge whatsoever. Only members of our Human Resources Team have authority to engage or authorize recruiting services. Any questions regarding recruiting services of any kind must be sent to jobs at associatedmaterials dot com.

About Houzz

Houzz is the leading home renovation and design platform in the world. We have a highly engaged community of over 40 million homeowners who leverage our technologies to find inspiration for their next home project, connect with over 2.5 million home design and remodeling professionals and discover products in the Houzz Shop.



Houzz is looking for a hands-on leader with a proven track record in managing diverse teams delivering against tight deadlines in a dynamic environment. This team is responsible for enabling a high-performing and reliable IT operation and robust infrastructure to power Houzz. You will nurture cross-functional synergy between your team and other internal partners, drive standardization practices and process improvements and create opportunity from complexity.

We are a fast-growing, ever-evolving and market-leading technology company. You are a digital thought leader and industry subject matter expert. The position can be based in Irvine, CA or Santa Monica, CA.







__________________





At Houzz, we strive to create and foster a strong family environment in our workplace. We collaborate to accomplish our goals, always working as a team. We aim to build a culture of inclusion — celebrating and leveraging our differences for the betterment of one another, our products and our community.

Houzz team members come from many backgrounds and bring diverse experiences to the company. We take pride in making each person feel at home.



Join Houzz in revolutionizing the home remodeling and design industry and have an impact on the more than 40 million homeowners who use our platform every month and the 2.3 million-plus home professionals around the world who are active on the site. Houzz has been named one of the most innovative companies in the world by CNBC and others, and is backed by top venture capitalists. At Houzz, you can help drive the future of an industry worth $1.2 trillion in the U.S. and Europe alone.



Our team members play a key role in guiding the direction of our company and are able to work across multiple groups to implement fresh ideas that allow Houzz to be the industry leader. If you are interested in applying your passion to create products that will transform the lives of millions of people who are designing, remodeling and decorating their homes, welcome to Houzz.





Houzz is an Equal Opportunity employer.

About this Role
Are you a natural problem solver that enjoys leading and working with others? Do you enjoy looking for ways to improve processes, systems, and operations? Would you like to help a growing company accelerate that growth through technology? If yes, then the Mouse is looking for you!

Position: Director of Information TechnologyDistrictQualifications:* Master's degree in a related field, preferred* Demonstrated professional experience in a district technology leadership role* Formal training or relevant experience with computer technology and networked information systems* Broad knowledge of instructional technology equipment and applications,on-line services, technology resources and integration of technology across the curriculum* Demonstrated ability to develop long range plans for technology application in the schools and conduct related budget analysis* Strong organizational, communication, and interpersonal skillsAvailability:August 17, 2020 through June 30, 2021Application Procedure:Apply Online Only

Job Responsibilities
Designs, develops, implements and manages all aspects of the College's Information Technology platform. Directs the development, implementation, and maintenance of the technology infrastructure of the College. The day-to-day duties will include but are not limited to the following: Develops a vision and strategic plan for Information Technology to support and guide the College's strategic plan; Manages the procurement, installation and maintenance of all computer hardware and software and all products/supplies necessary to keep computer systems operable to support customer needs; Directs and manages the operation of the Ellucian-Colleague ERP system and associated reporting systems. Directs the planning and development of the college's website to include all web applications; Consults with executive management, staff members and faculty for needs assessment; Provides exceptional customer service and end-user support for faculty, staff and student users; supervises and directs activities of the network and end-users staff and provides hands-on support as needed.



A bachelor's degree in communications, business administration, computer science (information technology), mathematics, statistics, management information science or a related field and two (2) years experience in telecommunications, data processing and/or information technology. Relevant experience may be substituted for bachelor's degree on a year-for-year basis.



Knowledge of principles and techniques of planning programs in information technology environments related to the priorities of the college. Higher education experience with voice/data communications, network infrastructure, VoIP telephone systems and internet security monitoring systems. The ability to establish and maintain a working relationship with end-users, technical staff, management, and vendors. Proficiency in using and maintaining Colleague - Ellucian ERP, to include all aspects of reporting and application lifecycle.

Job Title: IT - Infrastructure - SVP, Information Technology, Careventions
Description:
Tabula Rasa Healthcare - TRHC is a family of companies that leverage technology to improve healthcare. TRHC works with providers and insurers to identify multi-drug interactions and to reduce risk of medication-related problems. We have developed the first multi-drug interaction tool that identifies risk across a variety of safety factors and presents meaningful opportunities to mitigate that risk. This technology can be used to assess safety at the individual patient-level or to stratify medication risk at the population-level, and can be embedded within any EMR or other healthcare IT systems.

We are currently looking for an SVP of Information Technology. The SVP, CareVentions Information Technology will provide technology vision and leadership in the development and implementation of the CareVentions information technology (IT) program. He/she will lead in planning and implementing enterprise information systems to support both distributed and centralized clinical and business operations and achieve more effective and cost beneficial enterprise-wide IT operations.





















PLANNING/POLICY DEVELOPMENT


SYSTEMS ADMINISTRATION/REPORTING


TRAINING

Job Title: Information Technology Director, Global Risk Management
Description:
Information Technology Director, Global Risk Management

Job Description

With its broad roster of new stars and legendary artists, Warner Music Group (WMG) is home to a collection of the best-known record labels in the music industry including Asylum, Atlantic, Big Beat, Canvasback, East West, Elektra, Erato, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Reprise, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Warner Bros., Warner Classics, and Warner Music Nashville, as well as Warner/Chappell Music, one of the world's leading music publishers, with a catalog of more than one million copyrights worldwide.





The Warner Music Group Internal Audit vision is to provide high quality assurance and advisory services in a dynamic, innovative, and impactful way. Our work includes SOX, operational audits, and proactive risk management for the business. The Internal Audit department partners with the business to focus on the most important risks and issues facing the organization and delivers results that will make the biggest positive impact. We strive to be valuable business advisors that provide meaningful insights and solutions, not just information and recommendations. We continuously look for ways to improve our audit and risk management processes and leverage technology to maximize our impact. Our success is measured by the amount of internal control improvement, risk mitigation and overall positive change that we drive across the organization.

Our department has two pillars: A Global Risk Management pillar, and a traditional audit and SOX pillar. Our work within the Global Risk Management pillar includes risk assessment procedures, assisting in the development of policies and guidance around key risk areas, training and changing how the organization interacts with risk, and review / audit of key risk projects within the organization (e.g. system implementation, process transformation, information security, acquisitions, etc.).



Due to the expanded scope and remit in Internal Audit’s oversight, specifically the creation of a Global Risk Management function, we are seeking a dynamic and agile Global Risk Management IT Director to facilitate the growth of our services. In this role, you will help drive the evolution of a new Global Risk Management function within our organization. You will be on the ground floor of helping create meaningful pragmatic guidance for our organization to reduce risk, and drive informed executive decision making. You will also guide our internal and co-source teams in providing advisory review services that evaluate significant and transformational projects to mitigate risk and improve controls, operations, and compliance across our global organization. Your key oversight areas will include system implementation/transformation, cyber security, and information technology risk management. The Global Risk Management IT Director will report to the VP of Global Risk Management at WMG’s New York headquarters and play a key role in developing the global risk management function, conducting risk assessments, and supporting the delivery and execution of projects on a dynamic plan. This role requires a high caliber individual with extensive enterprise risk management, risk assessment, and IT audit experience in companies of similar size and complexity. The ideal candidate will possess excellent interpersonal skills, a strong work ethic, and the ability to influence decision making at a senior level.










Warner Music Group is all about our people. We are one global company made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business.

It is the mission of every member of the WMG team around the world to create a nurturing environment for artists, songwriters, and the people behind the music, every stage of their career. We strive to set WMG apart from the rest of the industry by embracing a philosophy of innovation that is part of our company's DNA.

Consider a career at WMG and be a part of one of the biggest forces in music today.



Click the “Apply” link at the top of the page, or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile, but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter.

Don’t be discouraged if you don’t hear from us right away. We’re taking our time to review all resumes, and to find the best people for WMG.

Thank you for your interest in working for Warner Music Group. We love it here, and think you will too.

Accordingly, please inform the Company’s Human Resources representative if you need an accommodation in order for you to complete any employment application-related forms or otherwise to participate in the application or selection process for the position for which you are applying. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity and will enable applicants to participate in the application and selection process and for employees to perform the essential functions of their jobs without imposing undue hardship on our Company. The Company also will make reasonable accommodations to an applicants or employee’s religious beliefs and practices as may be required by law, unless an undue hardship would result.

Description:
JFF seeks a strategic and service-driven Director, Information Technology (IT) to join its team in Boston, MA. Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer (COO), the Director will ensure the organization achieves its mission through IT solutions that enable growth and scale. In partnership with the COO, the Director will set a strategic vision for the technology use across JFF and deliver on that vision through the execution of various short- and long-term IT projects. Overseeing a team of 2.5 full-time employees, the Director will be responsible for managing the deployment and continued maintenance of complex, enterprise technology solutions across several geographically dispersed offices, as well as staff working remotely across the country, aimed at improving organizational and programmatic efficiencies. The successful candidate will be collaborative, results-oriented, and able to thrive in a mission-driven, fast-paced, and evolving environment. JFF is embarked on an exciting, substantial, multi-year investment in its information systems and operations, and the IT Director will play a critical role in leading this transformation .



IT Infrastructure Leadership

Establish and manage to an IT strategic plan and vision that aligns activities with organizational goals, supporting JFF’s rapid growth
Sit on and partner with JFF’s Technology Governance Committee on IT strategy, evaluation and special projects
Oversee the implementation or upgrade of technology solutions: bring an enterprise architecture perspective, engage stakeholders, help to identify specifications, source solutions, oversee implementation processes, and work closely with internal and external partners to ensure success in order to optimize staff productivity and foster an information- and data-driven culture
Identify IT or technology commonalities across JFF offices and functions and standardize methods and systems
Develop and maintain an IT infrastructure to ensure appropriate support of the organization’s needs, define and communicate plans, policies and standards for system implementation; ensure continuous and reliable delivery of IT services
Design, develop and maintain effective IT continuity and emergency plans
Recognize and define problems, invent and implement technology solutions, track and evaluate results against goals, and communicate progress to internal stakeholders
Research and stay current on IT strategy and operations, best practices and function as a subject matter expert in these areas; maintain an adaptable posture on technology changes to keep JFF current
Manage all IT vendors, including reviewing terms and conditions of contracts and ensuring contractual requirements are met and returning value to the organization
Liaise with JFF’s Board of Directors as needed, including periodically delivering presentations and updates on IT strategy and projects
Develop and manage the annual IT budget

Team Management and Leadership

Develop, mentor and coach team members to achieve individual and organizational goals; continue to build a team that provides exceptional service and organizational support
Maintain a culture of continuous learning; foster an environment of accountability, feedback, and team collaboration
Lead the organization’s IT infrastructure with a focus on learning and continuous development and improvement of processes and systems

Internal Partnership and Problem-Solving

Partner with JFF units to identify and support technology-based solutions which enable new or more effective ways of achieving our mission
Seek to integrate JFF enterprise systems, including Office365, Salesforce, project management software, HR and Fiscal systems, and others by leading adoption, training new users, troubleshooting issues, and documenting best practices and use cases to support standardization at scale

Systems Management and Support

Work with the IT team to operate an effective and responsive Help Desk by which all staff members get the IT support they need to do their best work everyday
Manage tasks and coordinate Help Desk assignments
Collect and analyze Help Desk metrics for departmental learning and process improvement
Collaborate with Knowledge Management and other technology owners in support of our technology systems. Research and develop clear feature and functionality guidance and policies, troubleshoot problems, and collaborate on providing high quality training and documentation.
Ensure that JFF’s data is protected by identifying threats and proactively monitoring security protocols and procedures



You have at least 10 years of relevant leadership experience and a proven track record of managing IT operations teams within large, scaling and/or technologically complex environments; experience working with geographically dispersed/remote teams is strongly preferred
You are mission-driven and can thrive working in a growth oriented and entrepreneurial environment
You bring significant experience managing direct reports and teams, providing direct feedback, thought partnership, coaching and performance management to support their success, particularly during times of growth and change
You demonstrate an ability to translate complex IT concepts to individuals at all levels including technical and non-technical stakeholders
You possess keen project management skills, and experience devising and establishing IT policies and processes that support broader organizational strategies and goals
You have the ability to identify and implement short-term solutions that maintain stability and achieve operating improvements while evaluating long-term requirements for continuous improvement
You have a proven ability to integrate new technologies into existing infrastructure
You bring strong verbal and written communication skills
You have an ability to build relationships with geographically dispersed staff at all levels and demonstrate a service orientation
You are data driven and leverage data and analysis to effectively solve problems
You model inclusive leadership, working effectively with diverse staff, and stewarding an organizational culture that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion, and an ability to apply JFF’s core values to all areas of your work
Industries: Marketing and AdvertisingNonprofit Organization ManagementFinancial Services

We recognize the difference our people bring to the business and #growstronger together.JOB PURPOSE:

The Director of Information Technology is responsible for the successful delivery of IT strategies, technical services/operations, and application development activities undertaken by the Foundation. This position reports to the Foundation CFO, and is responsible for our entire systems administration team in order to achieve goals, increase user satisfaction of our internal and external systems, and drive the implementation of all IT initiatives as our systems grow and the Foundation expands. The successful candidate will be familiar with network infrastructure, production support, and applications development, will be a change management expert, and extremely knowledgeable about the hierarchical and regulatory infrastructure of healthcare research information systems.





















The NSABP Foundation is a not-for-profit academic research organization with a 60-year history of conducting ground-breaking research studies in breast and colorectal cancer. The NSABP Foundation is an outgrowth of the National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project, instituted in 1958 as part of the National Cancer Institute's clinical trials program. In its history the NSABP has enrolled more than 110,000 women and men in clinical trials in breast and colorectal cancer. We have research sites at nearly 700 major medical centers, university hospitals, large oncology practice groups, and health maintenance organizations in the United States, Canada, and Ireland. At those sites and their satellites, about 5000 physicians, nurses, and other medical professionals conduct NSABP treatment and prevention trials.

The NSABP Foundation, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer committed to the value of workforce diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veterans, genetic information, and sexual orientation.

Role Overview:
CLA Professional Search has been retained by Hospice of St. Francis to identify a Director of Information Technology to serve their team.

Note: We do not accept resumes from headhunters, placement agencies, or other suppliers that have not signed a formal agreement with us.

Company Overview

Lennox International Inc. (NYSE: LII) is a 125-year-old, $3.8 billion company headquartered in Richardson, Texas. Lennox provides climate control solutions for commercial and industrial applications in more than 70 countries worldwide. The company designs, manufactures and markets a range of products for the heating, ventilation, air conditioning and refrigeration (HVACR) markets. Its products and services are sold through multiple distribution channels under brand names including Lennox, Bohn, Larkin, Chandler, and others.

Lennox operates in three segments: Residential Heating & Cooling, Commercial Heating & Cooling, and Refrigeration. The Refrigeration segment, also known as Heatcraft Worldwide Refrigeration (WWR), is a leading provider of commercial refrigeration systems and replacement parts in markets around the world. With segment revenues of approximately $535 million, its products are primarily used to preserve food and other perishables in supermarkets, convenience stores, restaurants, warehouses, and distribution centers, in addition to other applications such as data centers, pharmaceutical, and industrial process cooling.

As a part of WWR, Heatcraft Refrigeration Products (HRP) generates revenue of ~$300 million. HRP is the long-standing leader in the world of commercial refrigeration, providing climate-control solutions to the North American market. Heatcraft’s state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities in the cities of Stone Mountain and Tifton, Georgia, produce evaporators, condensers, and other top-quality refrigeration products for its market leading brands.

HRP has long been known for combining innovative technologies with precision engineering to design refrigeration systems capable of meeting the demands of the most rigorous operating environments. HRP uses a team approach for every project, working in collaboration with its customers to create smarter, more useful products that fit their real-world needs. In fact, because Heatcraft’s primary goal is finding perfect solutions for every customer, a large percentage of its products are custom-built.



The Director of Information Technology (IT) serves as a key member of the HRP leadership team and reports operationally to the VP and General Manager of HRP, and functionally to the VP, Engineering and IT – Worldwide Refrigeration Segment.

This position will leverage a dedicated team and works closely with centralized and shared LII and WWR IT competency groups. The leaders of these centralized IT groups would be peers to this position. This role also receives key support from the Lennox India Technology Centre (LITC).







A talented technology and business partner who is especially strong leading in a matrix environment. This leader will have demonstrated outstanding execution capabilities in the areas of e-commerce, supply chain and distribution systems, and manufacturing systems. As such, the successful candidate will have strong IT technical capability, and will understand the interplay of technology and business outcomes; and will have particularly strong business process knowledge/experience in a product manufacturing and distribution industry.

This individual will have experience managing a matrixed technology team in an industrial manufacturing environment.

We are looking to hire a Head of Digital Execution to join our Information Technology team. The focus of this role is to deliver an end to end solution on essential banking transformations. You’ll work with our Digital Platforms (Salesforce/Mulesoft platforms), lead the overall execution of projects, including platform evolutions, product sprints and releases, and platform integrity (environments, data exchanges, Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and technical solution execution). You’ll implement systems which will take the bank’s technology to the next level, positively impacting both Leumi employees and our clients.

Samsara, founded in 2015, is a leader in Industrial IoT and our mission is to increase the efficiency, safety, and sustainability of the operations that power our economy. Our solutions combine hardware and software to bring real-time visibility, analytics, and AI to operations across various industries. Samsara’s fast-growing team is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in San Jose, Atlanta, and London. Our team has raised $930M from Andreessen Horowitz, General Catalyst, Tiger Global, Dragoneer, AllianceBernstein Holding LP, Franklin Templeton, General Atlantic, Sands Capital Management and Warburg Pincus LLC.

Reporting to the CFO, this role will lead all aspects of global IT and information security, and will serve as a key member of the executive leadership team. As the Head of IT, you will manage the teams responsible for supporting Samsara employees around the world, building the infrastructure to operate core systems and applications, manage and scale our endpoint management systems, partnering with all key business functions, defining and maintaining an innovative and forward-looking security strategy, investing in team growth and development, and providing scalable services to meet Samsara’s dynamic business needs. The ideal candidate is highly self-motivated, analytical, thrives in a fast-paced environment, and has a proven track record of building and leading a successful team.

This is a full-time position at our office in San Francisco and includes Lyft/Uber commuter benefits; RSUs; 401(k) match; catered lunch four days a week; and 100% coverage on medical, dental, and vision benefits.






At Samsara, we welcome all. All sizes, colors, cultures, sexes, beliefs, religions, ages, people. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.


With the spread of COVID-19 globally, Samsara's offices will remain closed until further notice with the exception of phase 1 employees that require access to hardware and lab equipment.

Our primary concern is for the health and well-being of our employees as well as candidates. We have transitioned all interviews and new hire onboarding to be conducted virtually via Zoom video conferencing. We have allowed employees to work from countries and states where Samsara is a registered entity through the end of 2020.

If you have any questions or concerns before applying, feel free to contact us at jobs@samsara.com

A competitive edge, willingness to take risks, and a passion for driving clarity in ambiguous and complex challenges are a must.

Description:
Genesys Works is a national leader in providing pathways to career success for young adults students in underserved communities through skills training, meaningful work experiences, and impactful relationships. Currently in 6 cities across the country, we are positioning ourselves for future growth and have an exciting opportunity for a strategic business leader to join the National team as Director of IT.

Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, the Director of IT will provide the vision, leadership, and management necessary to drive the technology strategy needed to effectively grow Genesys Works.

Genesys Works is a $25M+ social enterprise with 70% of its operating budget funded through earned income from its revenue generating corporate internship model. The organization currently operates 7 locations with 135 permanent employees and over 1,700 student employees annually, and the organization is preparing for high growth over the next 5 years. This is an exciting opportunity for a strong business leader who can bring strategic vision, solid financial and IT leadership, and a commitment to providing opportunities for more Young Professionals throughout the country.

As a member of the National leadership team, the Director of IT will be the IT executive and serve as an advisor to the Senior Leadership Team and Regional Executive Directors, assisting them with technology planning and business process optimization and enablement. S/he will be responsible for overseeing technology processes, systems, training, infrastructure, and the technology team of the organization.

Location is flexible but Houston, TX; Chicago, IL; Washington, D.C.; Minneapolis, MN; New York, NY; or Bay Area, CA are preferred.

Key Responsibilities
Working in collaboration with the Senior Leadership Team and site Executive Directors, the Director of IT will be responsible for:

Developing and overseeing SMART (specific, measurable, attainable, relevant, time-based) metrics for technology enabled business processes, service processes, hardware, enterprise applications, and storage
Collaborating with Business Leaders on the Senior Team and Site Executive Directors to identify their technology priorities and technology requirements on a semi-annual basis
Strategic technology capacity assessment, planning, and maintenance on a semi-annual basis based on business needs



Directly supervising members of the tech team
Hiring team members
Performance assessment and development planning of team members
Planning and executing of all technology plans and budgets
Identifying and eliminating security vulnerabilities with strategic solutions that increase data and systems security
Directing and supporting the implementation of new software and hardware
Identifying and recommending new technology solutions
Managing the organization’s help desk (internal, external, or both)
Coordinating IT activities to ensure data availability and network services with as little downtime as necessary
The Ideal Candidate



The ideal candidate has proven executive leadership skills in the for-profit sector with companies operating across multiple sites/business units, blending strong strategy, team management, and technology implementation experience.

High integrity and commitment to Genesys Works’ mission, vision and values
Experience and track record to serve as a critical advisor and subject matter expert for technology and technology enablement of business processes, with ability to work across all levels
Communication skills providing complex ideas and information clearly and concisely, including, team members, internal leaders, Executive Directors, and site staff across the user community
Exhibits high levels of intelligence, analytical strength, and conceptual ability
Superior project management and presentation skills
Deep expertise in utilizing and customizing applications of Salesforce to enable an array of business processes, including Sales, stakeholder relationship management, and marketing processes and campaigns
Expertise in designing and configuring integrations with Salesforce to manage multiple business processes utilizing middle-ware such as Workato and Celigo, or similar integrations
Expertise with Netsuite and Adaptive and other HRIS and Performance management systems to enable financial, payroll, and HR processes
Experience optimizing technology performance, creating operational efficiency with artful application of technology, and reducing technical debt
Decisiveness when necessary, coupled with a willingness to seek input and build consensus
Experience managing and developing a remote team and across a multi-site business model
Experience in nonprofit technology management a plus; experience leading in a high-growth business preferred

Description:
About The Organization

The Executive Office of Labor and Workforce Development (EOLWD) is responsible for five agencies and departments under the organization. EOLWD and its agencies are committed to developing a world-class, highly skilled labor force to support business growth and innovation in the Commonwealth.



The Executive Office of Labor and Workforce Development provides secure and quality digital information, services, and tools to customers and constituents when and where they need them.



EOLWD Information Technology is looking for a motivated and civic minded Director of Information Technology to come on board as the organization moves to leverage cloud services and managed services in providing technology support to the EOLWD business units. The Director will lead the efforts of the IT organization in remaining current with various technology platforms and initiatives, as well work closing with EOTSS Technology and Cloud Teams in defining and building a scalable and robust technical platform for EOLWD. The director will define and deliver the technical direction under the supervision of EOLWD's Chief Information Officer necessary for EOLWD and its departments to meet the business and technical goals. Additional responsibilities:







Applicants must have at least (A) six (6) years of full-time or, equivalent part-time, professional, administrative, supervisory, or managerial experience in business administration, business management, public administration, public management, clinical administration or clinical management of which (B) at least two (2) years must have been in a project management, supervisory or managerial capacity or (C) any equivalent combination of the required experience and substitutions below.



I. A certificate in a relevant or related field may be substituted for one (1) year of the required (A) experience.
II. A Bachelor's degree in a related field may be substituted for two (2) years of the required (A) experience.
III. A Graduate degree in a related field may be substituted for three (3) years of the required (A) experience.
IV. A Doctorate degree in a related field may be substituted for four (4) years of the required (A) experience.
An Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Females, minorities, veterans, and persons with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.

Job Title: Managing Director, Global Strategic Accounts-Technology Vertical
Description:
SUMMARY
 The Managing Director, Global Strategic Accounts-Technology  is recognized as the leading sales strategist and business expert responsible for the overall success of one or more of our largest strategic technology clients, including end-to-end ownership of client’s revenue and margin growth. With a highly sophisticated understanding of customer needs, technology and competitor offerings this position will drive the digital strategic account strategy collaborating with all of the resources required to succeed while representing the entire range of IRM’s emerging portfolio of technology products and solutions.

As a UW employee, you have a unique opportunity to change lives on our campuses, in our state and around the world. UW employees offer their boundless energy, creative problem solving skills and dedication to build stronger minds and a healthier world.

UW faculty and staff also enjoy outstanding benefits, professional growth opportunities and unique resources in an environment noted for diversity, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits and natural beauty. All of which has allowed the UW to be nationally recognized as a “Great College to Work For” for six consecutive years.

The Department of Physics, the Department of Astronomy, the Institute of Nuclear Theory and the eScience Institute are some of the most computationally diverse units at the University of Washington. Each unit also has a distinct business model and mission. The Manager oversees all aspects of department computing, including planning, maintenance, development and security for these four units.

Architect, develop and deploy technical database, web and software solutions as part of the IT team.
Provide assistance to faculty, staff and students regarding pedagogical, technical and research issues such as data acquisition and analysis in research and instructional laboratories.
Plan and develop new initiatives and policies with input from faculty, staff, and students.
Oversee and coordinate computer technology plans with those prepared by other Departments and support units such as the College of Arts and Sciences, Classroom Support Services, Decision Support Services, and the Graduate School.
Manage, support, and enhance department computing, including core services (file systems, printing, managed desktops) as well as build upon services offered at the university and outside of the university.
Manage and communicate the technology lifecycle of software, hardware, and services the IT team provides.
Manage four FTE senior-level professional computing staff (recruitment, hiring, training, mentoring, performance evaluations, retention).
Breadth of experience to step into role of IT team members as needed.
Create and foster relationships with and between vendors: internal vendors (UW IT) as well as outside vendors like Dell, Pogo Linux, CDWg and others.
Administer funds that support department computing and information technology.
Seek funding for new computing initiatives from on-campus sources, grants, and national collaborations.



Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent work experience in technology management.
Seven years of work experience in IT or technology; demonstrated abilities managing and maintaining diverse, multi-platform computing infrastructure (Linux, Windows, and Mac OS X – clients and servers); five years supervisory experience; excellent written and verbal communications skills; ability to work with people (individually and groups) with a wide range of computer expertise in a complex environment.



Equivalent education/experience may be substituted for stated requirements.

Ten years of experience working in a major university, experience working with technology management methodologies such as Agile development.
Four years of experience managing budgets and working closely with the accounting functions in departments.
Demonstrated ability to manage change for both technical and non-technical users in an IT facility.
Understands and has worked in the research development cycle

The Police Department is the 14th largest Police Agency in the United States. The department has 3,300 full-time positions, including 33 in the department’s information technology (IT) division.

The vision of Highland Park Presbyterian Church is to lead all generations to become transformed followers of Jesus, for the flourishing of our city and beyond.

The IT Department seeks to advance that vision through providing an overall IT strategy that ensures efficient and effective use of IT systems, products and tools in order to resource and support the operations, mission and ministry of HP Pres.

What matters to our nation, is what matters to us. At Perspecta, everything we do, from conducting innovative research to cultivating strong relationships, supports one imperative: ensuring that your work succeeds. Description:
Why Join Us?

Be a hero for our rare disease patients

Ultragenyx is a commercial-stage biopharmaceutical company committed to developing novel therapies for the treatment of rare and ultra-rare genetic diseases. The company has rapidly built a diverse portfolio of small molecule, monoclonal antibody, mRNA and gene therapy candidates with the potential to address debilitating genetic diseases for which the unmet medical need is high, the biology for treatment is clear, and for which there are typically no approved therapies treating the underlying disease.

Developing new treatments for rare genetic diseases is challenging work. It takes courage, talent, and dedication to look past the easy answers and uncover new solutions that can make a meaningful impact. At Ultragenyx we push each other to perform at our very best, because we never lose sight of our mission – to make a difference in our patients’ lives.

Come join our team during this exciting time of growth and opportunities!



The Director of Global Regulatory Information Systems leads the regulatory information management (RIM) program for Ultragenyx globally (Ultragenyx Pharmaceutical (UGX) and Ultragenyx Gene Therapy (UGT)). This individual is a strategist, collaborator, and confident leader that understands the complexities of RIM and is passionate about driving and delivering meaningful changes to support our current and future RIM goals.

The position requires a solid understanding of Regulatory Affairs/Operations and extensive hands-on expertise in Regulatory specific technology (e.g. InSight Publisher/Viewer and Veeva Vault RIM), excellent business analysis and project management skills.

This individual collaborates with Global Regulatory Affairs (UGX/UGT) and other cross-company functions in driving the development and refinement of our existing and desired global processes to support a robust RIM program to take Ultragenyx into the future.

This individual will report to the Executive Director, Regulatory Operations. This role requires outstanding interpersonal, communication, leadership and collaboration skills along with the ability to synthesize information and translate it into meaningful strategy.











: All candidate activity and open positions are managed strictly through our Human Resources Department. Job Overview

We are seeking a Director of Information Technnology to oversee informatics for our Global Specimen Solutions Group is a high profile, high impact team that focuses on creating innovative data-driven solutions to improve the speed, cost and quality of drug development. The position will support Covance, a market leader in central laboratory and clinical services and top 5 provider of phase III clinical trial management services, Covance has assembled the most comprehensive investigator and clinical lab database in the pharmaceutical industry, spanning more than 11,000 protocols, more than 600 indications, more than 175,000 unique investigators, and more than 14 million patient visits over the past 10 years. The role of the informatics team is to lead breakthrough innovations that will unlock the power of this data to help pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies bring the miracles of medicine to the people in need faster and more efficiently.

The position supports directly Global Specimen Solutions in providing a unique market solution allowing large pharmas and biotech to see the location and availability of biospecimen for research and make real time clinical decisions.

This senior Informatics leader is responsible for building a prolific, agile and effective data sciences group by recruiting and nurturing elite talent, by building strong working relationships with diverse global business and client stakeholders, and by developing productive partnerships with leading technology and informatics service providers. Working in a highly collaborative environment, you will generate key insights that influence business decisions, drive product innovation, and lead engineering teams to prototype and launch data-enabled capabilities and product offerings. Key areas of focus include: 1) the integration and analysis of clinical, health outcomes, and social networking data to improve clinical research decisions, protocol design, clinical site selection, and patient enrollment; 2) the design of intuitive visual interfaces to enhance the efficiency and quality of clinical monitoring; 3) the development of advanced software systems and interfaces for clinical trial biospecimen management 4) the development of integrated dashboards for internal and external use; and 5) the development of analytic tools and methodologies for resource forecasting and utilization. As a recognized expert in the area of biomedical informatics, you will be active in the data sciences community and contribute to attracting, retaining and growing the best talent in a performance-driven organization.

We seek smart, focused, passionate self-starters who bring energy, new ideas and practical experience to a fast-paced and dynamic team, are obsessed with delivering useful and elegant solutions, and care deeply about their customers and each other.



Lead the informatics global strategy, proprietary software build, commercial developer execution for the purpose of supporting global specimen tracking, with data migration, collection, extraction, interface, reporting, compliance and user query activities surrounding GSS proprietary, third party and client specimen, informed consent, and ethical committee behaviors systems. The Senior Director, Technology will oversee direct project management of all systems implementations, from conception, development, validation, deployment to production including support to the resolution of data loading issues.



PhD in computational, physical or life sciences with a strong quantitative focus, or BS/MS with equivalent experience.






As an EOE/AA employer, the organization will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant's race, age, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

The VP of IT is established to direct, plan, organize and control all information technology activities of the bank to ensure the effective, efficient and secure operation of all networks, systems, and technology. This position is responsible for leading and maintaining efficient operations of the IT team and function.












This position requires 40 hours each week, usually within the 7 a.m. 5 p.m. time frame, and being on call, as needed, 24 hours a day. Travel to branch locations and industry and community events is required.



This position is responsible for the direct supervision of the IT and banking system administrator personnel of the Bank.

The main differentiators are quality at scale, dedicated customer service, flexibility, and its customer-facing technology platform.

Description:
VP of Information Technology

This is a key position responsible for leading the strategic and tactical technological direction for a growing healthcare company in Pittsburgh, ensuring the delivery of focused systems that will enable the growth of the company while driving down costs through the use of contemporary hardware/virtual strategies and maintaining a stable, high availability environment. This role will require an executive who is capable of forming a strategic vision for a unified and integrated IT department and bringing it into reality in a timely manner.

Reporting to the CAO, the VP of IT will partner with the management team, and operational leaders in managing the company’s ongoing evolution and growth. The VP of IT will ensure that the company becomes a technology leader in its space delivering differentiated value to internal and external stakeholders.









I was very impressed with Nate’s attention to detail and making sure I had as much information and guidance as possble prior to my phone interview. His comments helped understand the employer’s perspective better.

As Director of Strategy & Operations at Nightfall, you will take the lead on high priority projects and drive them from analysis to execution. You'll be a thought and execution partner to the leadership team on their key initiatives. You'll partner with sales & product teams to drive strategic analyses, optimize business performance, and deliver best-in-class execution. From optimizing our go-to-market motion, to evaluating partnerships, to driving cross-functional initiatives, you'll develop strategic recommendations with actionable insights in a hyper-growth environment.


Qualifications




Nightfall (formerly known as Watchtower) is a cybersecurity startup dedicated to helping enterprises secure and manage their sensitive data. As a leading enterprise technology company, our product affects the personal data that people entrust businesses to store & process with care every day. Critical data in the modern enterprise is often sprayed across a broad set of cloud systems (e.g. SaaS & data infrastructure), and it’s a herculean task for security teams to monitor, manage, and protect this highly sensitive data. Via machine learning, our product makes it easy for companies to discover, classify, and protect this sensitive data across their cloud footprint - such as their corporate SaaS, data infrastructure, and APIs. In doing so, we prevent data leakage, provide unprecedented data visibility & protection across the cloud, and enable compliance. We're a technology startup based in San Francisco and Palo Alto, well-funded by leading institutional investors with deep expertise in the cybersecurity industry. Learn more at our website www.nightfall.ai or by reaching out via email at careers@nightfall.ai.

Overseeing a team of 2.5 full-time employees, the Director will be responsible for managing the deployment and continued maintenance of complex, enterprise technology solutions across several geographically dispersed offices, as well as staff working remotely across the country, aimed at improving organizational and programmatic efficiencies. About The Organization

The ASPCA (American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals) is the first animal welfare organization established in North America and serves as the nation's leading voice for animals. The organization's mission is to provide effective means for the prevention of cruelty to animals throughout the United States. The ASPCA provides local and national leadership in three key areas protecting and rescuing animals from crisis, assisting animals in communities and advancing legal protection for animals.

The ASPCA was founded by Henry Bergh in 1866 on the belief that animals are entitled to kind and respectful treatment at the hands of humans, and must be protected under the law. Headquartered in New York City, the ASPCA maintains a full-service animal hospital, spay/neuter clinic, rehabilitation center for canine victims of cruelty, kitten nursery and adoption facility. In addition, the ASPCA announced a groundbreaking anti-cruelty partnership with the New York Police Department in 2013, which has resulted in a record-breaking number of arrests and animals' lives saved.

The ASPCA also operates programs and services that extend nationwide, including a National Field Response team that rescues animal victims of natural and man-made disasters, a fully-subsidized spay/neuter clinic in Los Angeles, a Behavioral Rehabilitation Center for fearful, under-socialized dogs, and a 24-hour, 365-day Animal Poison Control Center that provides pet owners and veterinarians with live, on-call assistance related to toxic products and substances. In 2015, the ASPCA acquired Humane Alliance, now called the ASPCA Spay Neuter Alliance, which is the nation's leading training and education organization focusing on high-quality, high-volume spay/neuter.

The ASPCA is a privately funded 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization supported by more than 2 million animal advocates across the country.

For more information, please visit www.aspca.org.

What We Do
Peer Health Exchange (PHE) is a national non-profit organization that empowers young people with the knowledge, skills, and resources to make healthy decisions. We do this by training college students to teach a robust skills-based health curriculum in under-resourced high schools across the country. Since our founding in 2003, we have trained more than 8,500 college student volunteers to deliver effective health education to over 115,000 public high school students in Boston, Chicago, Los Angeles, New York City, the San Francisco Bay Area, and Washington, DC. In 2016, PHE launched a five-year strategic plan to focus on growing our effective model while partnering with health and education systems, as well as communities to build a more integrated, sustainable model for health education. You will be joining an incredibly passionate, collaborative, and committed team working together towards our vision of advancing health equity.

What Inspires You

Do you aspire to show up for young people and your community each day? Are you a bold thinker and an inclusive collaborator? Does authentic communication and honest feedback help you continuously learn and grow? Do you find joy in both the journey and the results? Then keep reading!

Additionally, you will customize, integrate and train staff on our Salesforce platform across many departments. You will report directly to the Assistant Vice President, Finance & Administration, the head of PHE’s Finance, Technology & Operations (“FTO”) team.
