Description:
There#s no place like Liberty Healthcare Management Come explore career opportunities with#Liberty Healthcare Management, a dynamic leader in the healthcare industry. Join us! We are currently seeking an experienced: INFORMATION SECURITY DIRECTOR Full Time: M - F JOB SUMMARY: Builds a strategic and comprehensive information security program that defines, develops, maintains and implements processes that enable consistent, effective information security practices. Develops and implements policies, procedures, and plans related to: security of computer systems, networks and telecommunications; health information security and privacy compliance; business continuity, risk management, loss and fraud prevention; and emergency and incident response. Works closely with the Privacy Officers to ensure alignment between security and privacy compliance programs; acts as a liaison to the Information Systems and Compliance departments; assists with breach determination and notification processes under HIPAA and applicable state breach rules and requirements. Responsible for initial and ongoing information security risk assessment and analysis, mitigation and remediation; conducts audits to find holes in security platform. Establishes and administers a process for investigating and acting on security incidents which may result in a privacy breach. Identifies and prioritizes security initiatives and standards; addresses privacy, confidentiality and standards administration. Investigates security breaches; develops and directs technical teams in the investigation and resolution of a variety of complex health information privacy and security issues using a systematic approach. Establishes and maintains technical computer and network security systems and protocols. Establishes and maintains administrative computer and network security systems and protocols. Monitors and reviews logs of computer systems and network activities for possible unauthorized intrusion. Oversees, develops and delivers security training to healthcare personnel at all levels relative to the privacy and security of health information. Researches and recommends appropriate hardware and software to implement and maintain health information privacy and security. Initiates, facilitates, and promotes activities to foster information security awareness within the organization. Evaluates security trends, evolving threats, risks and vulnerabilities; implements tools to mitigate risk as necessary. Collaborates with senior management, Privacy Officers, and Corporate Compliance Director to establish governance for the security program. Manages security incidents and events involving electronic protected health information (ePHI) Ensures organization has audit controls in place to monitor activity on electronic systems that contain or use electronic protected health information (ePHI). Oversees periodic monitoring and reviewing of audit records to ensure that activity is appropriate; includes but is not limited to logons and logoffs, file accesses, updates, edits and printing. Participates in the development, implementation, and ongoing compliance monitoring of all BA#s and business associate agreements, to ensure security concerns, requirements, and responsibilities are addressed. Serves as information security consultant to all departments for all data security related issues. JOB REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor#s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent professional experience. Required: CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional) Preferred: CCNPS (Cisco Certified Network Professional Security), CCSP (Certified Cloud Security Professional), CISA (Certified Information Security Auditor), CISM (Certified Information Security Manager) 4 years# experience as an ISD or equivalent position for medium to large size organization. Five to ten years# progressive experience in health information security management, health information management, information systems and/or health risk management is required Experience in driving change in security functions within multiple organizations. Experience working with IT security guidelines and requirements outlined or as driven by HIPAA, PCI-DSS, FedRAMP, SOX, GBLA, etc. Experience with contract and vendor negotiations. Executive-level written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills, and the ability to communicate security and risk-related concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences. Poise and ability to act calmly and competently in high-pressure, high-stress situations. Must be a critical thinker, with strong problem-solving skills. Excellent analytical skills, the ability to manage multiple projects under strict timelines, as well as the ability to work well in a demanding, dynamic environment and meet overall objectives. High level of personal integrity, as well as the ability to professionally handle confidential matters, and show an appropriate level of judgment and maturity. Experience with security related tools such as Nessus, Carbon Black and patch management. Appropriate certification in risk management and/or health care compliance preferred. Visit www.libertycareers.com for more information. Background checks/drug-free workplace. EOE.

Job Title: Vice President of Quality Improvement and Informatics
Description: Description: HealthRIGHT 360 is a non-profit healthcare organization with programs throughout California. Across its many programs, HR360 provides a wide range of medical, mental, educational and enabling health services to address the needs of its community across the lifespan. This includes primary and urgent care, dental care, substance use disorder treatment including detox, residential, intensive outpatient and outpatient, medically assisted treatment (MAT), psychiatric and behavioral health care, case management and support for social determinants of health, and care coordination. HR360 programs serve populations including individuals experiencing homelessness, people of color, the LGBTQ community, ex-offenders, and substance-using individuals. We are looking for an executive with expertise in Quality Improvement and Informatics to help develop and spread a culture of quality through the organization using data to drive practice transformation and meet the needs of the communities we serve. The VP of QI and Informatics works across the organization with the Chief Healthcare Officer to ensure that data-driven performance management and quality improvement programs are designed and implemented in a manner that aligns with an organizationâ€™s overall strategy to achieve the Quadruple Aim. Acts as a chief advocate for spreading a culture of quality throughout all levels of the organization through effective leadership and communication to the Executive and Management team, Boards, Committees, and staff. Works well in a team and promotes team-based work in assuring the quality of care. Works with the Chief Healthcare Officer to create a quality improvement structure and annual quality improvement plan for the organization. Benefits: Health, Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance Retirement Paid vacation Hours: Monday-Friday 8:30-5:30 Responsibilities: Leadership duties: In conjunction with the Chief Healthcare Officer develops a strategic vision, scope, and mission for quality improvement and data-driven practice. Along with the Chief Healthcare Officer leads LEAN efforts in the agency. Provide reporting and informatics leadership. Leads patient-centered medical home transformation and recognition processes. Continually reviewing the latest technology available for healthcare systems and recommending updates and changes as needed. Along with Chief Healthcare Officer provides leadership to assigned areas including participation or facilitation of committees or workgroups. Actively coaches the health system staff and leaders how to continuously raise the standards of excellence in patient safety, quality, and patient experience by advocating for best practice and evidence-based medicine inpatient care. Appropriately uses quality improvement tools and methodology, such as PDSA, Lean, Six Sigma, and Statistical Process Control Analysis on a large scale, organization-wide interventions. Supervision duties: Provides direct supervision to Quality improvement staff. Provides regular performance appraisals for staff. Provides coaching and support to Quality improvement staff. Administrative duties: Creating of QI structure and plan with oversight and accountability for reaching goals. Researching and developing quality improvement programs to provide services that lead to better healthcare outcomes. Supports or organizes QI meetings in conjunction with the QI manager or director as appropriate. Develops and gives QI training for the Board, Executive Team, and Staff. QI/Informatics duties: Assists the Chief Healthcare Officer in overseeing a corporate-wide quality improvement program inclusive of all medical and behavioral health programs, develops and maintains a written Quality Improvement Plan and an annual evaluation of the planâ€™s effectiveness. Works with the EHR, BI, Information Systems, and Networks department to develop the technology infrastructure needed to support quality improvement programs if needed. Measuring and evaluating data to determine the ultimate impact of the programs on both the operation and the health of clients. Assist QI managers and directors to support clinical and operations leaders with program development and performance data reviews. Trains staff and leadership on quality improvement methodologies and theories, and provides oversite and consultation to support various improvement initiatives and utilization management efforts. Analyze the data to uncover more effective ways to deliver care or to examine the system itself to pinpoint better ways to get the information doctors and nurses rely on to them more efficiently. In collaboration with the Chief Healthcare Officer, develops and maintains a performance measurement work plan and reporting calendar to ensure timely data collection, aggregation, analysis, and reporting of established performance measures related to key operational and clinical processes and outcomes. Implementing processes that streamline reporting. Proactively monitors and implements systems to achieve and surpass key quality indicator goals; collaborates with providers, nursing staff, consultants, community agencies, and agency partners to improve the quality of care and to resolve identified problems. Facilitates regular quality management meetings with key stakeholders; develop staff quality improvement capacity and involvement in quality management. Collaborates with other clinical leadership in leads and/or participates in the development of root cause analyses and formulation of a corrective plan of action. Collaborates with other health care professionals and departments to improve the quality, safety, effectiveness, and efficiency of care delivery across the agency. Tracks outcomes, disseminates data and designs dashboards, communicates shared learnings, and ensures the sustainability of systems quality initiatives by participating in several high priority quality committees across facilities. Works with clinical leadership to provide peer review. Experience: Experience with EMR applications, MS Office, SQL (preferred), Crystal Reporting (preferred), HTML (Preferred). 2+ years of Management experience (Required) Provider experience in behavioral health (Preferred) Demonstrated project management skills. 1+ years in health systems, services, care settings or customer service areas (Preferred) Demonstrated interest in data, quality improvement, and technology (Preferred) Education Bachelorâ€™s Degree with a focus on quality and informatics (Required) Master's Degree (Preferred) License and Certifications: Certification or formal training in informatics (Preferred) Skills: Must be detail-oriented with strong analytical, communication, and critical thinking skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office products. Proficient in conferencing communications software. Cooperates and maintains a good rapport with all levels of staff, inter-program departments, vendors, and community leaders. Able to learn new software quickly. Work in a HIPAA compliant environment. Able to work independently and to set priorities while managing several projects simultaneously. Able to quickly adapt and learn in an ever-changing healthcare technical, contractual, and regulatory environment. Data Visualization design experience & aptitude. Indeed Hire and HealthRIGHT 360 are working together to find the best candidate for this job. By applying, you agree to be contacted by our agent, Indeed Hire, and receive updates via text and phone about your application. Job Type: Full-time Experience: Provider experience in behavioral health: 1 year (Preferred) health systems, services, care settings or customer service: 1 year (Preferred) EMR applications, MS Office, SQL, Crystal Reporting, HTML: 1 year (Preferred) quality and informatics project management: 2 years (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Job distance: San Francisco, CA: Between 31 and 40 miles (Preferred) Work Location: One location Benefits: Health insurance Dental insurance Vision insurance Retirement plan Paid time off Schedule: Other

Description:
Your Opportunity

Schwab is recruiting to hire a results-oriented technology leader with a consistent record in leading large scale data acquisition and conversion efforts in a financial services industry setting. We are looking for a Managing Director for Reference Data Management who will excel in leading a dynamic team, in a fast-paced and Agile environment, to develop a strategy and then implement it at an enterprise wide level in support of large scale mergers and acquisitions.



The main responsibility of the Managing Director is to take technology ownership and be the single point of accountability for planning and implementing the strategy. This is to acquire, transform and convert non-financial and financial data supporting large Merger & Acquisition initiatives at Schwab. You will lead the organization of teams, preparation of platforms and designing and optimizing processes that engage with acquired data, systems and organizations to execute the conversion of client centric data as well as balances and position data from acquired entities to Schwab’s Broker/Dealer platform.

This role requires leading individual contributors, subject matter specialists and team managers, as well as effectively collaborating cross enterprise with other technology peers, executives and business partners. You must have strong technology implementation, organizational and people leadership capabilities as well as the experience of leading large Agile product development teams. The ability to understand, develop and align with technology and business strategies and goals, and communicate to senior leadership is a crucial component of the role. You should have a passion for influencing and inspiring teams in developing innovative solutions.

Description:
Currently we are seeking a Director IT Business Operations to direct the activities of IT Business Operations, including IT Strategy, IT Finance, IT Sourcing, and IT Vendor & Contract Mgmt. The Director, IT Business Operations role is critical to ensure the IT function operates efficiently as a business unit in order to provide the best possible services to internal and external customers.

Coordinate ongoing IT Strategy activities, including annual planning, regular reviews, communications, governance.

Provide central coordination for annual IT budget planning, working directly with cost center owners.

Total IT Operating Budget: $72 Million. 2020 Capex (non-Transformation): $3.4 Million. 2020 Transformation Capex: $45 Million.

Facilitate forecasting reviews with cost center owners.

Facilitate spend activity and purchase requests for IT software, hardware, and services. Determine proper action plan for spend and procurements business requirements.

Strategic vendor 2020 budgeted totals: SAP ($7.7 Million), Accenture AMS ($6.7 Million), Salesforce.com ($6.4 Million), Microsoft ($5.9 Million), Descartes ($3.9 Million)

Monitor upcoming renewals and notify cost center owners of contract requirements.

Evaluate ongoing contract spend against budget and forecast.

Maintain monthly IT financial reporting and contribute to monthly reviews and discussions of variances with IT leadership.

Drive and monitor application, IT asset, and contract database information.

Provide central coordination of application and technology licenses, including central procurement, license allocation and reporting, and annual license planning.

Perform regular reviews of, and identify opportunities to improve, IT department processes and controls. Update IT documentation as appropriate.

Perform regular reviews of, and identify opportunities to improve, IT business continuity procedures. Coordinate reviews with relevant business process owners to ensure IT business continuity aligns with core business continuity procedures.

Coordinate and facilitate regular IT operational reviews.

The IT department maintains hardware, software and equipment for over 750 employees and over 150 vessels. The Director of IT is responsible for overseeing and managing the Company’s information technology (IT) operations; overseeing the IT support staff; ensuring maintenance of hardware and application software; planning and overseeing of projects and budgets.



Centerline Logistics is a leading provider of marine transportation services in the United States. Centerline Logistics operates on the United States West Coast (including Alaska), New York Harbor, the U.S. Gulf Coast and the Mississippi River System. Centerline Logistics is the parent company of eight businesses specializing in marine services and a bulk liquids terminal business. Centerline Logistics provides accounting, administrative, human resources, safety and environmental services, as well as operational oversight to the subsidiary companies.

Job Title: Executive Director, Information Assurance & Cyber Security Division
Description:
Summary

Securing Travel, Protecting People - At the Transportation Security Administration, we serve in a high-stakes environment to safeguard the American way of life. In cities across the country, we secure airports, seaports, railroads, highways, and public transit systems, thus protecting our transportation infrastructure and ensuring freedom of movement for people and commerce.



For additional information about our agency please:

The Executive Director, Information Assurance and Cyber Security Division (IACSD) in Information Technology (IT), Transportation Security Administration (TSA), Department of Homeland Security (DHS) serves as the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) responsible for TSA’s cybersecurity strategy, policy and operations for information technology. IACSD will develop and implement cybersecurity strategy and policy for all information technology within TSA under the auspices of the respective DHS framework. IACSD is responsible for security operations, oversight and governance of security authorization processes, and assuring compliance with the Federal Information Security Modernization Act (FISMA). The IASCD will be responsible for oversight of the development of training plans for all security staff and provide ongoing guidance for all security staff. You will have oversight of the development and implementation of security tools and procedures to ensure the proactive protection of applications, networks, servers, workstations, and other information technology. IACSD is responsible for securing the TSA information technology (IT) environment by assessing security risks and vulnerabilities and developing methods to deal with the risks and vulnerabilities in a proactive manner. The Executive Director, IACSD will run the TSA Security Certification and Accreditation Program.

Occasional travel - Position requires occasional travel.

Yes

Description:
Description

We are seeking a Director of Information Technology to be based at our corporate headquarters in Chadds Ford, PA! Arora Engineers, Inc. is a growing firm that welcomes individuals with a thirst for knowledge and the energy to tackle projects that help take the infrastructure of our world to the next level. Description:
Director, Business Development - Information Ventures

Director, Business Development

Information Ventures

Recognized by FORTUNE magazine as one of the “World’s Most Admired Companies,” Quest Diagnostics is the world's leading provider of diagnostic testing, information and services that doctors and patients need to make better healthcare decisions. They are pioneers in developing innovative diagnostic tests and advanced healthcare information technology solutions that help improve patient care.

With corporate headquarters in Secaucus, NJ, Quest Diagnostics is a Fortune 500 company traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: DGX) and included in the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index. With 2019 revenues of around $7.7 Billion and approximately 46,000 employees and 6,600 patient locations across the US, Quest Diagnostics serves half of the physicians and hospitals in the US with their large variety of products and services.

The company offers the broadest access to diagnostic testing services through its network of laboratories and patient service centers and provides interpretive consultation through its extensive medical and scientific staff. Quest Diagnostics also provides services to employers, life insurance companies, other commercial labs, clinics, health plans, government agencies, and organizations involved in clinical trials research.

Approximately 150 million times each year, patients and their physicians rely upon Quest Diagnostics results to make important healthcare decisions and approximately one third of U.S. physicians – and many of the country’s leading hospitals and health systems – relies on Quest Diagnostics healthcare information solutions to foster better patient care and outcomes.





Quest Diagnostics is the world’s leading provider of diagnostic testing, information and services that patients and doctors need to make better healthcare decisions. Their services range from routine blood tests — such as total cholesterol, Pap testing and white blood cell count — to complex, gene-based and molecular testing. They perform medical tests that aid in the diagnosis or detection of diseases, measure the progress or recovery from a disease or confirm that an individual is free from disease. In addition, they have specialized expertise in cancer, cardiovascular diseases, infectious diseases, and neurology.



In the $60 Billion and growing US Diagnostic Testing Market, Quest Diagnostics is the leader. Quest Diagnostics’ reputation as a leading innovator, provider of high value, low cost solutions and its financial strength and flexibility make it well positioned to capitalize on the evolving healthcare landscape.



Quest Diagnostics’ long-term strategy is to become the undisputed world leader in diagnostic testing, information and services.




Quest Diagnostics’ vision is to empower better health through actionable insights. Information Ventures is an intrapreneurial team that is helping to deliver this vision by providing advanced clinical, financial and operational insights to stakeholders across both the care and therapeutic continuums.

Quest provides analytical solutions for leading public health organizations and therapeutics companies in the pre- and post-market as well as for clinical trials design, physician outreach and patient outreach.

Quest also provides healthcare solutions for patients, healthcare providers and provider organizations, payers, including:


Quest leverages considerable set of unique assets to deliver differentiated solutions, including a tremendous clinical repository, relationships with half the countries providers and hospitals in the United States, over 2000 patient service centers, over 650 active EMR interfaces, and approximately 15,000 mobile care professionals. Quest’s Big Data environment provides high-recency access to a clinical database goes back to 2005, with an average of 150 million unique patient encounters per year.

The successful candidate will be responsible for growing the commercial presence and success of the Clinical Trials solutions for Sponsors, CROs and Patients as well as supporting the growth of our pre- and post-Market Analytics program for Pharma and Public Health entities.

Location for this position is flexible within the U.S.

Executive Director Quality & Patient Safety
Send This Job to a Friend
Schedule
Full-Time
Shift
Day
Job Details
The Executive Director of Quality and Patient Safety will work collaboratively with the Chief Quality Officer (CQO) to implement clinical quality and patient safety activities for the NCH Healthcare System. This position is responsible for continuous improvement of safety, quality and satisfaction in the care delivered. The Executive Director of Quality and Patient Safety is committed to advancing healthcare quality and safety by focusing on improved outcomes and efficiencies, increased capacity and provision of safe, timely, cost-effective, patient-centered care. This position supports a culture of high reliability and utilizing data driven measures across the organization to develop programs to improve the quality and safety of care and services to our patients. With an ever-changing, fast paced healthcare environment, the Executive Director of Quality and Patient Safety guides future-focused transformation through strategies and tools such as evidence-based practices and standardization; the use of data analytics to achieve effective and efficient operations; and flexibility in promoting quick adaption to opportunities or changing needs for optimal patient outcomes.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Other duties may be assigned. With the CQO and Chief Medical Officer (CMO), the Executive Director of Quality and Patient Safety will implement the organizations plans in clinical quality and patient safety on our journey to organizational high reliability. This position will continually assess, review, evaluate, develop and implement programs to expand what the organization is doing to achieve the bold goals as outlined by the NCH Strategic Plan. Responsible for ensuring all external data submission is accurate, complete and timely for external reporting. In collaboration with the CQO, provides quality performance improvement consultation to hospital service lines. Develops, implements, and monitors the Quality Assurance and Performance Improvement annual plan and forecasts toward the achievement of the True North goals and objectives. Leads and supports the effort to develop a culture of safety with the goal of becoming a Highly Reliable Organization with a goal of zero harm. Partners with the executive leadership teams and departments to ensure the quality program effectively measures, assesses and continuously improves the care and services provided. Participates in organizational intensive assessments and root cause analysis reviews with the CQO/CMO to identify system issues. Serves as a key partner for Medical Staff and administrative leaders to achieve True North goals and advance the vision for clinical excellence and the effective use of resources through CQI. Works collaboratively with IT, hospital and clinic leadership and medical staff leadership to ensure performance data is analyzed, communicated and routinely provided in accordance with achieving True North. Improves data monitoring tools and metrics for analyzing and reporting Crimson data to enhance quality initiatives including the development of dashboards for key quality improvement initiatives. Engages and supports leadership in developing process improvements based on best practice, standards, and regulations, in partnership with Lean Transformation Leaders and clinical/support operations. Provides Quality oversight of the Peer Review Process to include OPPE, FPPE, and case review for the Peer Review Committee. Patient Experience Program: Collaboration of service departments that enhance the patient experience; track and monitor patient improvement initiatives with priorities targeted to improve patient experience. Supports LEAN principles of continuous improvement, functioning as a champion of change. Prepares, plans and leads all activities of the Quality Assurance Committee. Responsible for preparing and coordinating documents for external surveys (e.g. Leapfrog and AHA survey). Responsible for oversight of the data abstraction for CMS reportable measures. Participates in Joint Commission Taskforce and responsible for compliance with PI standards.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS Required Education: Master's Degree in Nursing RN Licensure. CPHQ preferred. Lean Leader Certification and acts as a Lean Leader Coach and resource for facilitating performance improvement and patient safety. Minimum Experience: 5+ years of progressive management experience in an integrated health system, with experience in the areas of clinical quality management, performance improvement, patient safety and patient experience. Key characteristics of the incumbent will include: Ability to inspire, create, and articulate a shared, compelling vision which translates into actionable measures to attain the organization's strategic performance goals. Knowledge: A broad and in-depth knowledge of quality management, patient safety, health information technology and peer review to enhance physician performance and practice efficiency. Special Skills/Equipment: Proven ability to work cross-functionally in team environments to develop, evaluate, and execute best practice initiatives designed to promote excellence across the care continuum. Demonstrated innovative ideas in health care delivery with ability to influence and acquire necessary resources across departments. High emotional quotient with a mature, self-confident demeanor that is effective and credible across all levels of the organization, including senior management and medical staff. High level of proficiency with analytic tools and ability to display data for action-oriented results.

NCH Healthcare System, we strive to build a diverse work force through equal opportunity employment that embraces and leverages the differences everyone has to offer. Job Title: Identity and Access Management Goverance and Compliance Leader
Description:
Identify and Access Management (IAM) Governance and Operations Leader - Denver, Colorado - United States

Do you have a passion for information security?How about unleashing your skills in a hugely successful business that is committed to moving money for better? Are you looking to embark on a unique challenge and really make a difference? Join Western Union as a IAM Governance and Operations Leader



We re a FinTech that s using insight from customers and colleagues worldwide to improve financial services for families, small businesses, multinational corporations, and non-profit organizations. We re a team of over 10,000 people spanning 200 countries and territories. We believe when money moves, better things happen.



We will look to you to manage account/user lifecycle management and account/user master data to ensure compliance with IT general controls, policies and procedures. You will support internal and external audit by providing IAM evidence in cooperation with IT and business owners. You ll escalate audit issues and communicate audit status in a timely manner as well as lead policy compliance with user access activities resulting in a well-controlled environment. You will develop and implement improvements to control and update processes based on findings and work proactively with internal and external auditors to identify improvement opportunities. You will serve as an IAM subject matter expert for projects to ensure access management is implemented appropriately and ongoing support needs are addressed.

For this role, you will have a Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field and 8+ years of experience in Information Technology with a primary focus on operations. You will have 3+ years of prior IT Audit experience. You ll need to have knowledge of Information Security principles such as NIST Cybersecurity Framework and basics of Information Security policy, techniques and implications across computing platforms. You will have IAM relevant technical security skills for identity governance, access management, privileged access management, user provisioning/deprovisioning, multi-factor authentication and single sign-on. You will need working knowledge of SQL and LDAP with the ability to identify, fix and delegate issues.



Western Union is transforming its business and shaping the financial services sector by driving quality, convenience, and customer service to new levels of excellence. It s an exciting time for our organization, as the largest cross-border money transfer operator, trusted by millions of consumers around the world. If you re ready to unleash your potential to help drive change through bottom-up innovation, apply now.

We re a company on the move, and we want our people to grow and develop. You ll have plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and build a career, as well as a great salary and benefits package.

Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and success. Western Union is proud to be an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer. The company will provide accommodation to applicants, including those with disabilities, during the recruitment process, in accordance with applicable laws. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy or related medical conditions), national origin, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, or any other protected category.

Description:
What You Will Do

As the Head of Information Security for our US business you will report into the US CIO, while also forming a key part of the Group Security leadership team with a dotted line into the Group CISO. You'll help shape the information security strategy for the US alongside your colleagues in Group Security, using metrics and KPI's to demonstrate progress and the resulting improvements in our security posture.

We’re a delivery-focused organisation going through a company-wide transformation - we need to be first to market in a highly competitive and heavily regulated industry. You'll work with both our US business and Group Security to ensure the continuing evolution of how Information Security engages with corporate and product technology teams, enabling the adoption of DevOps and Agile across all of William Hill’s business, promoting autonomy for teams while ensuring a continuous improvement in security standards.

The role will involve extensive working with engineering, development, and management teams, and validating the appropriate implementation of technology controls through enabling suitable audit mechanisms.

This role will suit a solid and experienced security professional with a background in technical disciplines, most recently in Security Architecture, as well as having experience in localizing information security policy, practices, and procedures.

This role requires someone highly knowledgeable about the business environment and who can ensure that information systems are appropriate, fit for purpose, pragmatic and proportionate.

The ideal candidate is a business leader, a knowledge builder/sharer and an integrator of people and processes. The role requires coordinating disparate drivers, constraints and personalities, while maintaining objectivity and a strong understanding that security is just one of the business's activities. The holder of this role should have a track record of competency in the field of information security, with 10+ years in the security industry, 5 of which should have been as a people leader where opportunities to showcase leadership skills have arisen and been taken.

Description:
Position Summary

Vista is experiencing strong success, resulting in increased demand for consulting services and growth of VCG’s Product and Technology team. Our team operates across the investment lifecycle including evaluating the risks and strengths associated with the product and technology of potential new investments as well as partnering with portfolio companies to implement and drive operational excellence in software development by optimizing people, process, tools and technology. This is an exciting opportunity to own and define product and technology best practices within highly-distinguished software companies throughout the world.



Understanding product and technology maturity and their ability to support the investment thesis is critical to success and long-term value creation.

In addition, this individual will partner with other members of the Product and Technology practice to advise portfolio companies to achieve transformational success, by improving or changing their technology organization, stack and processes aligned with the value creation plan.

Austin, TX / Chicago, IL / Remote, USA












Do you aim to be the best in your field? Do you enjoy partnering with talented executives and collaborating on challenging business opportunities? Are you energized by making good businesses great? Are you motivated by seeing others succeed? Join us – we are seeking a leader to help drive sustained long term value creation of our companies by identifying and mitigating product and technology risks during diligence.



Vista Consulting Group is the operating and consulting arm of Vista Equity Partners (www.vistaequitypartners.com), a private equity firm that specializes in acquiring software, data, and tech-enabled companies with over $57 billion in cumulative capital commitments.

The VCG team works in conjunction with the Vista investment professionals and key portfolio company employees to help current and newly-acquired businesses strengthen their operations through the implementation of standardized, repeatable and proven processes and methodologies. Explore our current (and past) companies here: https://www.vistaequitypartners.com/companies/



The Vista family of companies represents, collectively, the fourth-largest software company in the world. We also have a relentless focus on talent – within Vista and across our companies – meaning you will work shoulder-to-shoulder with thoughtful, curious, and talented executives. In 2019, several of our CEOs were named among the top 50 SaaS CEOs: https://www.thesoftwarereport.com/the-top-50-saas-ceos-of-2019/

Your position within VCG would provide you with an opportunity to strengthen your existing skills, grow and widen your capabilities, and offer you an unparalleled opportunity for personal development and career growth. This position will serve as an executive leader at VCG helping shape our companies as well as the careers of talented software executives at VCG and beyond. We take a “build-your-own career” approach and actively support the long-term career ambitions of our top performers across the entire Vista family.

Position: Director of Information Services

FLSA: Exempt

Schedule: This fulltime position will primarily work out of the Augustine Institute office in Greenwood Village, Colorado

Executive Vice President



The Director of Information Services will oversee all elements of Augustine Institute Information Technology. Responsibilities include:











Full-time employees receive numerous benefits including competitive compensation, medical, dental, vision, and other insurance, a generous paid time off plan and paid holiday schedule, and a 403(b)-retirement plan with company match. Daily Mass is typically available at the Greenwood Village Chapel.



The Augustine Institute is a registered 501(c)(3) Corporation. Our mission is to serve the formation of Catholics for the New Evangelization. Through our graduate school, media, and parish programs, we equip Catholics intellectually, spiritually, and pastorally to renew the Church and transform the world for Christ.

In 2005, as a response to the call of Pope St. John Paul II, Catholic scholars established in Denver a graduate school dedicated to transforming Catholic education for the New Evangelization. Since then, the Augustine Institute has become the fastest growing Catholic graduate school in the United States and has quickly expanded into a multi-faceted institute providing strategic, disciple-based parish programming and leadership formation to dioceses and parishes across America.

In July 2015, the Augustine Institute and its partners launched FORMED, our digital, state-of-the-art, online platform (often referred to as a “Catholic Netflix”), which makes available the best Catholic content from a host of leading Catholic apostolates.

In November 2015, the Augustine Institute entered into a merger with Lighthouse Catholic Media, which included its Parish Consultant independent contractor salesforce; the Parish Kiosk Program, CD of the Month Club Program, and other channels; and what is now the Ignatius Press-Augustine Institute Joint Publishing Venture.

Job Title: Director of Enterprise Applications & Business Intelligence
Description:
Req Number: 123012301

Overview

Boston Public Health Commission (BPHC) positions itself as a leader in public health, which enable us to develop applications, collect and analyze a trove of data. The Information System Department enables BPHC to tell our data story through business intelligence and develop innovative data-drive applications. Our data driven strategy is focused on advancing a new data platform, with a focus in three key areas:




Under the direction of the CIO, with considerable latitude for independent initiative and judgment, the Director of Enterprise Applications & Business Intelligence will manage the development and implementation of public health information systems that effectively support existing and future public health programs consistent with standards of regulatory agencies, HIPAA and BPHC policy. The IS Director will be responsible for managing the day to day operations and implementation of the BPHC Health Information Exchange. The Director of Enterprise Applications & Business Intelligence will support the development of strategic direction for public health informatics within BPHC.

This position will work closely with Information Technology to define and implement solutions according to business strategies and goals. Supervises BPHC Information Systems Services Staff and Information Systems projects.



Responsible for the management and day-to-operations of the IS Team.

Ensures IS Operations are managed effectively to support programs.

Works with Bureaus/Programs to identify business requirements.

Develops strategies for data consolidation, archive and recovery, and implementation of an enterprise data solution.

Manages the development and implementation of applications, databases, and systems.

Manages the development and implementation of the BPHC internal and external websites.

Manages business requirements and project management processes.

Develops strategies to support current and future applications and databases.

Define strategies that will bring the organization to the next level in technological advancement by providing solutions that will productize as well as provide solutions to current business needs.

Analyze and have a deep understanding of current technologies and business needs and recommend solutions for automation and AI with fresh eyes.

Manages the development and implementation of the PHC HIE.

Implements best practices related to electronic data transmission, storage, HIPAA and other relevant security standards.

Ensures implementation of "best practices" for Health Information Management.

Communicate effectively with cross-functional teams.

Work in confidential capacity with CIO.

Meet regularly with CIO regarding all aspects of program operations, including but not limited to matters pertaining to program staff and other confidential matters.

Operate independently.

Uses independent judgment and discretion to make decisions affecting the program and staff as it relates to program operations/services and BPHC policy.

Make and recommend management and personnel decisions regarding the ISS, including but not limited to promotion, transfer and assignment of staff, and imposition of discipline. Represent management in grievance and arbitration process, including but not limited to hearing and adjusting grievances, and attending grievance and arbitration hearings.



Performs other duties a required

BS in Computer Science or directly related field (e.g., Information Technology, Information Science, etc.) is required with a minimum of seven (7) years of relevant experience.

An MS or other advanced degree in a relevant technical discipline and /or health informatics is preferred. Project management experience related to information systems, websites and computer information databases, including three (3) years' experience supervising, training, and leading staff in data management at a large or complex organization.

Experience in the public sector and a unionized environment preferred.



Knowledge and/or experience with HL7, meaningful use is essential.

Experience working with data relevant to public health monitoring initiatives, such as adverse event reporting, health alerts, epidemiology or health informatics a plus.



City of Boston Residency Required, A Criminal Offenders Records Information request must be completed for this position. However, a record is not an automatic bar to employment but is reviewed in relation to the job applied for., Any position that requires an advanced degree will be subject to education verification, The Boston Public Health Commission is an EEO Employer and all applicants meeting the minimum requirements are eligible to applyNon-UnionSAL$110,000 to $120,000 annual DOE
Full-time Monday to Friday - evenings, occasional weekends, on-call as required

Job Title: Director of IT Infrastructure Portfolio Management
Description:
Company Description

Biogen has one of the most exciting pipelines in the Biotech / Pharmaceutical industry. The company has been growing rapidly and with this growth comes a number of exciting opportunities to work with our expanding business areas.





Key focus areas include planning and maintaining our portfolio of program investments, managing our operating budgets, understanding demand patterns across our many IT stakeholders that leverage our services, and providing user experience support for key programs to ensure we maximize the benefits our IT investments.

This cross functional position includes the development and implementation of a multiyear portfolio plan, a yearly budget for both project and operations, driving monthly financial processes, engaging IT functional stakeholders to understand demand and communicate new/enhanced IA&O services, and provide user experience and organizational change management solutions to enhance the value of our investments and maximize use of existing platforms.

Beyond Portfolio Management, the position calls for an influential leader who can establish a strategy across multiple domains, communicate within and outside of IA&O, motivate colleagues, challenge internally within their team and with stakeholders, and work to continually develop their team of dedicated IT professionals. This leader will be responsible for identifying and driving functional improvement agendas that modernize and speed delivery of Biogen’s IT Infrastructure.












Additional Information

Key focus areas include planning and maintaining our portfolio of program investments, managing our operating budgets, understanding demand patterns across our many IT stakeholders that leverage our services, and providing user experience support for key programs to ensure we maximize the benefits our IT investments.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

At Capital One, we’re building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.

Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.

Director of Product Management - User Data Platform

Capital One is the only founder-led Top 10 bank in the US. We offer industry-leading credit cards, checking accounts, savings accounts, auto loans and other financial products that are central to the way that more than 65 million people live every day.

We are building a user data platform to power the next stage of our privacy-focused data strategy with customer choice at the center. Weichert Workforce Mobility is hiring a Client Service Director - Relocation in Downers Grove, IL. The Client Service Director - Relocation is responsible for ensuring excellent client service delivery through operations management, account management, financial management, as well as team coaching and development.

Job responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:

Engages strategically with the Regional Vice President, Vice President Client Services, and Weichert global office leaders regarding account plans, client strategy, and relationship management. Other account management responsibilities may include client reviews, process redesign, or customer service enhancements and improvements.
Drives execution against operational goals while achieving internal and external scorecard targets. Leads a team of colleagues in meeting Weicherts obligations to its clients and owner. Regularly reviews reporting, analytics, capacity, data integrity and other indicators facilitating proactive and effective team management.
Manages financial performance across the client base to achieve revenue goals and profitability targets. Ensures that service fees and referral fee revenues are recorded accurately and timely. Monitors and supports collecting aged receivables within the guidelines established by the Company and in concert with the Weichert Accounts Receivable group to ensure proper Company cash flow.
Coaches, trains, and manages performance of team members. Assumes the primary responsibility for the professional development and training of the Service Team. Professional development and training exercises include one-on-one coaching sessions, continuing education forums, and external training programs.
Directly supports sales efforts aimed at growing the business. Attends sales meetings, best and finals and other meetings to demonstrate Weichert capabilities. Partners with implementation team upon award of new business to on-board the client successfully.
Cross-selling relocation and assignment services to their client base. Positions and pre-sells transportation, tax, V&I, domestic relocation and other related solutions where such opportunities exist.
Supports new technology and other process initiatives and provides support and subject matter expertise to the Information Technology group as needed.
Manages a portfolio of domestic and international relocation engagements. Acts as the single point of coordination for various phases of the relocation process. Services delivered in the team include policy and benefit counseling, workflow administration, home sale management, referral fee collection, financial services, and supplier coordination and file documentation.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Job Requirements



Bachelors degree required
Masters degree preferred
Certified Relocation Professional (CRP) certification preferred
Three (3) or more years of global mobility leadership experience



Direct client interaction and advisory experience required



Ability to analyze and evaluate business process in order to indentify and implement solutions
Strong knowledge and command of global mobility management, customer service delivery, problem resolution, business processes, workflow, project management and operations management
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite of products
Strong people management skills
Excellent relationship management skills
Strong oral and written communications skills, especially with clients and senior management
Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment
Strong attention to detail

Description:
The University of Virginia (UVA) seeks a national leader to serve as the inaugural Vice Provost for Enrollment (Vice Provost). Reporting to Provost Elizabeth Magill, the Vice Provost will work with senior leaders in the University, including the President and Chief Operating Officer, to integrate and oversee a single unified Office of Enrollment, including the Office of Undergraduate Admissions, the Office of Student Financial Services, and the Office of the University Registrar. The office will provide an enhanced and cohesive enrollment experience for students throughout all phases of the student lifecycle.

The Vice Provost will develop and implement an innovative strategy to attract applicants, select and recruit admitted students to the University, and support their financial and enrollment needs as students, including academic records, financial aid, and bursar services. In doing so, the Vice Provost will take a systematic and data-driven approach to anticipating the changing higher education landscape, demographic shifts, and student needs.

With an enrollment of just over 25,000 undergraduate and graduate students, UVA is known for its student experience, access, affordability, and commitment to excellence in teaching and research. UVA seeks a Vice Provost who will grasp the exceptional nature of this preeminent University and will spearhead an assessment and develop a forward-looking strategy to enhance UVA’s current practices, from recruitment to admission to student financial and academic services.


The Vice Provost will be a collaborative, people-centric, data-driven decision-maker able to lead a next-generation enrollment strategy that leverages advanced analytics and technologies to ensure UVA is a leader in delivering integrated and high quality admission, enrollment, and student services. They will have successful experience leading institutional initiatives, strategic planning, change management, program development, and enrollment promotion.

Job Summary

The University of Kentucky is seeking a dynamic leader to propel UK HealthCare to the next level of advanced medicine, continue to build on our extraordinary growth, and serve as the enterprise-wide Chief Operations Officer (COO). Reporting directly to the Executive Vice President for Health Affairs, the COO will be responsible for operationalizing UK HealthCare's vision to become one of the nation's best health systems.
The COO oversees the operations for UK HealthCare, the university's academic health system which includes the flagship Albert B. Chandler Hospital, Kentucky Children's Hospital, Good Samaritan Hospital, Eastern State Hospital, numerous ambulatory clinics, community partnerships (i.e. Lexington Clinic and Lexington Surgery Center) and any future hospital and provider practices that may be acquired. It is critical for the success of this position to work in a collaborative dyad with the Chief Physician Executive to strategically implement clinical and operational best practices, innovate new support systems throughout the health care enterprise and cultivate multiple types of care under one unified mission. The COO will be the senior operations leader on UKHC's leadership team working with system hospital CEOs, clinical leadership, and other key operational leadership.





This search is being led by UK's internal Executive Search Team. For more information about the position, please contact Mary Beth Bracken at 859-257-3348 or via email at marybeth.bracken@uky.edu. All inquiries will remain confidential. Nominations and applications are invited.
Skills / Knowledge / Abilities



The successful candidate will have a Master's degree and at least 10 years of successful experience at the administrative leadership level (C-suite) in a complex/multiple site healthcare system. The preferred candidate will have strong operational, fiscal, and leadership skills with the ability to grow an organization and deliver results, as well as, the aptitude to operationalize a vision.

Does this position have supervisory responsibilities? Yes Preferred Education/Experience
A Master's degree and at least 10 years of successful experience at the administrative leadership level (C-suite) in a complex/multiple site healthcare system.

Description:
Cinch Home Services, a leader and trusted provider of home management solutions is looking for top-notch talent! Cinch is seeking an experienced Director Digital and Business Architecture to join our team.

The Director Digital & Business Architecture is a cross-functional senior leadership and delivery role on the Technology team focused on both rationalizing our digital strategy and developing / maintaining real-world modern end-to-end Business and Digital capabilities to support our enterprise growth and digital transformation agenda. This role will be critical in creating and aligning our Business, Operations, Marketing, Digital and overall Functional and Capability Roadmaps to our Enterprise Technology Roadmap.

The Director Digital & Business Architecture works across leadership and delivery teams to develop the end-to-end business and technical solution roadmap and architecture for the Digital Channels and Enterprise Technology initiatives. This role, in concert with our engineering leadership, will be responsible for the creation of the solution approach, rationalization of the solution, presentation/communication of the solution, and as a guide to the delivery teams for realization of the solution. This role is also responsible for collaborating with the respective senior business stakeholders, software teams, and vendors in ensuring well-defined business and technology roadmaps, capability models, and prioritized product backlogs in support of the overall business strategy.

This role also requires facilitating the transition of the business transformation plan into real-world solutions including the delivery plan and collaborating on architectural governance and controls over implementation.

Description:
The Deputy Director of Library Services for Access Services is responsible for the ongoing management over the Technical Services and Information Technology divisions of the Department of Library Services through subordinate managers and supervisors. This position also includes oversight of the Library’s circulation services, websites and administration of the SPLASH consortium, including ILS management, shared resources, policies and procedures and budget preparation.

The Deputy Director of Library Services serves as a member of the Library’s executive management team and is responsible for the planning, development and implementation of goals, objectives, policies, priorities and performance standards for the assigned divisions; participating in strategic planning for major initiatives and new directions for library services; providing innovative leadership in a culture characterized by excellent service; developing, evaluating and resolving service needs and related methods of delivery; and, creating and maintaining relationships with community members and organizations.

The Ideal Candidate is someone who has a progressive vision of library services, is detail oriented, can manage and complete multiple complex projects concurrently, possesses a broad understanding of library information technology and technical services operations, is customer focused, enthusiastic and has a sense of humor. Strong organizational and project-management skills are required as is good judgment, tact and discretion. Effective written and oral communication skills are critical to the position.

DFC is recruiting for 1 full-time Personal Services Contractor (PSC) position; Chief Data Officer. The Chief Data Officer (CDO) is responsible for envisioning data-enabled strategies, data and analytics governance, and oversight and implementation of key data and analytic initiatives to deliver on DFC’s mission. In this highly visible role, the PSC will collaborate with DFC OIT leadership and liaise with DFC customers to improve organizational effectiveness and use of data analysis across the agency.

POSITION SUMMARY
Reporting to the President and COO, the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) is a member of the Straus Family Creamery Executive Leadership Team and strategic thought partner to the President and CEO, maximizing business strategies to drive value creation. This role is responsible for leading the finance organization in planning, implementing and managing all financial and accounting activities including:  long- and short-term business planning, risk management operations and information technology, budgeting, forecasting and analysis, pricing analytics, accounting compliance management, and cash flow.  S/he will be responsible for the ongoing development and monitoring of control systems designed to preserve company assets and report accurate financial results.  The CFO collaborates cross-functionally, providing financial and accounting expertise to help functional leaders in decision-making.  The role is both strategic and operational, and we are looking for a hands-on, strong leader who views the role as an active participant driving the business.

The Chief Administrative Officer (CAO) for the Department of Psychiatry/Senior Director, Neuropsychiatry has a reporting structure to the Department Chair and to the Assistant Dean of Administration, School of Medicine as well as the Administrator, Ancillary Services and Neuropsychiatry, UCI Medical Center. The CAO serves in an advisory capacity to the Department Chair on all matters related to the departments operations, taking initiative to develop administrative policy as required and works closely with the Chair to facilitate effective decision-making processes. The overall administrative responsibilities of the CAO for Psychiatry include: human resources management of approximately 44 staff, 83 full-time faculty, 10 part-time faculty, 51 volunteer faculty; strategic planning; annual preparation and financial management of $8,781,342 million budget with annual expenses in the amount of $8,728,544 in 205 accounts; extramural and industrial relations; contracts and grants totaling approximately $5,152,219 professional fee billing totaling $8,197,987 annually; practice management of 1- Medical Center bldg. 3 departmentally managed clinic; active participation in the hospital managed clinics; affiliation agreements; residency program administration consisting of 34 residents and 6 fellows, and 1 forensic fellow; space and facilities management for approximately 13,430 (not including the Medical Center space)assigned square footage; equipment resources and planning; Information Technology; marketing and fundraising as well as regulatory compliance and policies related to administrative activities.

Description:
Who We Are

IT Direct is a Hartford-based Information Technology consulting firm that helps our partners leverage the power of technology to reach their business goals. We have developed a strong bond with our clients and a reputation for responsive, high-quality, efficient work.

IT Direct provides its staff with a dynamic, positive, and high energy work environment. We are proud to have been listed as one of the “Best Places to Work in Connecticut” by the Hartford Business Journal for the last three years as well as recognized nationally as one of “The 50 Best Places to Work in 2016” by Inc. Magazine. Inc. Magazine has also recognized IT Direct on their Inc. 5000 list for 6 years, a list of the fastest-growing privately held companies in the US. Additionally, we have been recognized as one of the Top 40 tech companies in Connecticut for 5 years. We know that our success depends on how well we serve our clients, and that this level of service will be determined by the quality of people that make up our team. As such we expect, and accept, only the best.



We currently have an open position for an IT Director/virtual Chief Information Officer (vCIO), working out of our headquarters in West Hartford, CT and reporting directly to the Vice President. This is a client-facing, office-based position. The vCIO’s principal role is to provide planning, budgeting, and strategic direction to our clients in relation to information technology and systems. This position focuses primarily on the business relationship with the client and leveraging technical resources to improve their operational efficiencies. Client satisfaction, contract renewals, and uncovering additional sales opportunities fall under the realm of the vCIO.



Providing IT leadership and planning for a diverse group of clients as well as being the internal champion for each client within IT Direct through the following:




You are a strategic thinker with excellent communication skills and a strong technical background. You work best in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment. You are able to work well both independently or with a team of experts. You enjoy the challenge of solving practical problems while handling a number of variables. You confidently present your ideas to high level executives and can share your expertise in non-technical language.

Description:
About Hopper

At Hopper, we’re on a mission to make booking travel faster, easier, and more transparent. We are leveraging the power that comes from combining massive amounts of data and machine learning to build the world’s fastest-growing travel app -- one that enables our customers to save money and travel more. With over $235M CAD in funding from leading investors in both Canada and the US, Hopper is primed to continue its path toward becoming the go-to way to book travel as the world continues its shift to mobile.

Recognized as the fastest-growing travel app by Forbes and one of the world’s most innovative companies by Fast Company two years in a row, Hopper has been downloaded over 40 million times and has helped travelers plan over 100 million trips and counting. The app has received high praise in the form of mobile accolades such as the Webby Award for Best Travel App of 2019, the Google Play Award for Standout Startup of 2016 and Apple’s App Store Best of 2015.

Take off with us!



We’re looking for a customer obsessed individual to join our Technology team to architect, design and build robust features that directly impact Hopper. You’ll work with a highly skilled and motivated crew of technical and product-focused individuals, intent on delivering the best experience possible for those who use our product. Your efforts and expertise will frame and solve some of the most challenging problems in mobile commerce at a scale and complexity that few organizations can match.

You have strong software, data modeling and analytical skills. Everything we do is focused on customer experience, data measurement and delivering value at speed. You’ll be the technical leader responsible for making that a reality and lead the group making that happen.

The School of Information and Library Science at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill ( SILS ) invites nominations and applications for the Louis Round Wilson Distinguished Professorship, a tenured, full professor, appointment. Established through Dr. Wilson’s estate, this distinguished professorship continues a strong legacy of librarianship. As UNC’s first librarian, and SILS founder and first dean, there have been few individuals who have left a bigger mark on the UNC campus, the state of North Carolina, and librarian profession than Dr. Wilson.

We seek a dynamic senior leader to join us in shaping the future of librarianship and archival practice, including the roles these institutions and staff will play in empowering marginalized voices, bringing communities together, and understanding the constantly changing impacts that memory and new knowledge have on our society.

Our internationally renowned programs educate leaders who shape information policy and inspire junior scholars to new directions in research and practice. We seek a senior researcher and thought leader who will help the faculty define new research and curriculum directions, mentor junior faculty, and serve as a voice for ethical and human-centered approaches to data-driven information models and services. Our campus provides myriad opportunities for collaboration with scholars across the university system, with the campus Libraries and Information Technology Services, and with researchers from nearby universities.

The School offers the Bachelor of Science in Information Science, Master of Science in Library Science, Master of Science in Information Science, and Doctor of Philosophy degrees. The School also offers an undergraduate minor in information science, a Post-Master’s Certificate in data curation, and a variety of graduate certificates and dual degrees (see http://sils.unc.edu for details), and a non-residential Master of Professional Science degree in digital curation.



An earned doctorate in Library Science, Information Science, or related field is required at the time of employment. Candidates should provide evidence of research and teaching excellence and leadership at national and international levels.



Faculty are expected to engage in research, teach, advise students, participate in School, University, and professional activities, and otherwise share their expertise at both undergraduate and graduate levels, including work with doctoral students. Candidates should be excited by and able to thrive in an intellectually stimulating multi-disciplinary environment. We seek a collaborative colleague who will form partnerships within the school and across the campus. Scholars with fresh and innovative ideas, a commitment to professional engagement, and an appreciation for cultural diversity are encouraged to apply. While not required, we are particularly interested in someone who can bring prior experience in libraries to the position.


The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, disability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or status as a protected veteran.

Job Title: Chief Operating Officer, Greater Washington Community Foundation
Description:
Greater Washington Community Foundation
Chief Operating Officer
Washington, D.C.

Organization Overview

Since 1973, the Greater Washington Community Foundation has been a champion of thriving communities and a catalyst for change through local philanthropic engagement, effective community investment, and civic leadership. We work with donors and partners to enhance the quality of life in the District of Columbia, Montgomery County, Northern Virginia, and Prince George’s County.

The Community Foundation, under new leadership, will be embarking on a new strategic plan, building on the Foundation’s rich history of social justice grantmaking and community leadership initiatives and prioritizing community voice to ensure the Greater Washington region is an equitable, just, and enriching place for all residents to live, work, and thrive.



Reporting to the CEO, the COO will drive key operational and administrative functions to ensure the Community Foundation has the infrastructure needed to continue the organization’s success and impact. The COO will lead critical initiatives such as a technology transformation that allows the Foundation to expand its footprint and meet the increasing needs of our funder holders, partners and of our community. The ideal candidate will bring extensive nonprofit executive leadership experience and a demonstrated record of managing and enhancing the administration of a high-performing organization. The top candidate is a creative problem-solver who thrives on identifying solutions and focusing on what’s possible while facilitating strong collaboration and communication across the organization. They will bring strong emotional intelligence, authenticity, and a proven ability to help individuals and teams achieve their full potential. In addition, the COO will embody and nurture a strong and inclusive culture that reflects our values.

Tenure-track faculty teach classes, develop new educational materials, assist with curriculum review and assessment, perform professional duties and participate in departmental and institutional functions, including department meetings and committee work. Tenure-track faculty report to the chairperson of the Health Professions Department. Academic departments are led by a peer who serves as a department chair for a three-year term. All tenure-track faculty are in the pool from which the chair is appointed. Faculty are responsible for preparing and teaching courses in the department and will be assigned at the Brighton Campus (or other, as appropriate). The successful candidate will bring expertise in Health Information Technology to MCC.
