Company Name: United States Naval Special Warfare Command
Description:
Summary

This is a RE-ADVERTISEMENT of Announcement Number: DE-10818631-20-JS. Applicants that have previously applied NEED to re-apply to this announcement. You will serve as the Executive Director of the Program Executive Office for Command, Control, Communications, Computers and Intelligence (PEO C4I) within the Naval Information Warfare Systems Command.



You will provide leadership, guidance, and management on program evaluation and integration for all assigned programs, projects, and initiatives.

You will provide guidance to Program Managers regarding acquisition management issues in all phases of acquisition for PEO C4I programs.

You will participate in Acquisition Coordination Teams and acquisition program reviews, and provide an assessment of technical, resource, and scheduling readiness.

You will serve as Source Selection Authority for source selection activities above the Program Manager level.

You will represent the PEO as the acquisition authority for research and development, acquisition, and integration efforts at Navy and Department of Defense (DoD) wide meetings and planning/decision processes.

You will ensure planning efforts, including plans for research, development, and acquisition; strategic plans; and other program planning initiatives are consistent with overall program policy and priorities.

You will develop approaches, review resource requests and budget justifications, and prepare program review boards to defend resource requirements.



Conditions of Employment



QUALIFICATIONS REQUIREMENTS: Applicants will be assessed against qualifications which fall into two areas: Executive Core Qualifications (ECQs) and Mandatory Technical Qualifications (MTQs). Failure to provide a separate narrative statement which describes fully and concisely how your experience meets the competencies described in the Executive Core Qualifications (ECQs) and Mandatory Technical Qualifications will eliminate you from consideration. EXECUTIVE CORE QUALIFICATIONS: You will be assessed against the Executive Core Qualifications (ECQs).They are designed to assess executive experience and potential - not technical expertise. They measure whether you have the broad executive skills needed in a variety of senior executive positions. Failure to meet a qualification requirement will disqualify an applicant. (Each must be addressed separately in your Supplemental Narrative Statement. The ECQs must not exceed 10 pages.) More information on these core qualifications are available at http://www.opm.gov/ses/recruitment/ecq.asp The ECQs describe the leadership skills needed to succeed as an SES; they also reinforce the concept of an "SES corporate culture." Refer to the OPM Guide to SES Qualifications for specific information and guidance on the ECQ requirements, the C-C-A-R model, and examples of good qualifications statements at the website: http://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/senior-executive-service/reference-materials/guidetosesquals_2012.pdf (Note: Current career Senior Executive Service (SES); former career Senior Executive Service (SES) who are reinstatement-eligible; and graduates of OPM-certified Candidate Development Programs are not required to address the ECQs, but must address the Mandatory Technical Qualifications.) 1) Leading Change: This core qualification involves the ability to bring about strategic change, both within and outside the organization, to meet organizational goals. Inherent to this ECQ is the ability to establish an organizational vision and to implement it in a continuously changing environment.

Education

Additional Information

This position is in the Senior Executive Service (SES), a small elite group of top government leaders. SES members possess a diverse portfolio of experiences including strong skills to lead across organizations. As an executive, you will influence the direction of innovation and transformation of the federal government and lead the next generation of public servants. This position is not covered by the Department of Defense Priority Placement Program. Additional vacancies may be filled by this announcement. Veterans' preference does not apply to the Senior Executive Service. A tentative offer of employment will be rescinded if the selectee fails to meet the pre-employment requirements, including failure to report to any of the scheduled appointments. If you are unable to apply online and request information about the Alternate Application process, please see the How To Apply section of this vacancy announcement. Federal annuitant information: The selection of an annuitant is subject to the Department of Defense and Department of the Navy policy on the employment of annuitants. Policy information may be found at: http://www.secnav.navy.mil/donhr/Documents/CivilianJobs/FedCivAnnuitants.pdf. A relocation incentive is generally a single payment intended to offset some of the relocation costs experienced by the selectee. A relocation incentive may be authorized. This position is eligible for part time, full time or ad-hoc telework at the discretion of management. Recruitment incentives may be authorized to eligible new hires.

Job Title: Corporate Technology Product Owner/ Business Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Nashville based Corporate Technology Product Owner/ Business Analyst to join our Corporate Technology organization.

Corporate Technology partners with AB’s Corporate Business units (Corporate Finance, Human Capital, Legal and Compliance, Risk, Audit and Enterprise Technology) to deliver technology solutions and services. Each business aligned Corporate Technology team include responsibilities of product management, project management, business analysis, software development, user experience, system administration and production support.

Corporate Technology supports 100+ applications including SaaS, in-house-developed, and internally hosted vendor applications. Examples of these systems include Workday, SmartStream, ServiceNow, Coupa, Oracle FCCM, MicroFocus Digital Safe and Supervisor, NASDAQ Compass and custom financial, compliance and identity and access management systems.

The Corporate Technology organization reports to AB’s head of Technology and Operations and is comprised of 5 teams and 75+ staff members.

The will be responsible for product management, project management, technical analysis, business analysis, tier 3 technical support and vendor management for the technology related to Administrative Services and Enterprise Systems. This individual will work directly with senior business sponsors and will coordinate with the teams within Corporate Technology and across the larger technology organization, to define, deliver and support systems and services.



This role is responsible for product management, project management, technical analysis, business analysis, tier 3 technical support and vendor management for the technology related to Administrative Services and Enterprise Systems. The application portfolio is comprised of SAAS products, internally hosted vendor products and custom developed applications. There is a separate development organization aligned to support this role.

The Administrative Services Technology current portfolio consists of Office Space and EMS (Facilities and Space Management platforms), Bear River (physical mail tracking and deliver platform), Equitrac and PaperCut (enterprise wide secure print solution), Ultramar Concur (travel booking and reporting), Symphony (reprographics), Building Management System, Apex (lease management) and visitor concierge services. There is an active effort on the modernization and rationalization across solutions in this space.

The Enterprise Systems related applications focus will be on ServiceNow, our internal change management, CMDB, service request and other platforms as well as our custom built Identify and Access Management related applications. AB is in the process of migrating many custom applications and processes to the ServiceNow platform which will be a focus of this role.





This individual will take a leading role in the rationalization and modernization of legacy technologies consumed by the Corporate clients and the firm as a whole. The Service-Now service catalog project is an example of this opportunity, as the final result will streamline the way employees interact with the Technology organization and will ultimately enable technology operational and fulfillment automation. This individual will also take a leading role in the implementation of new technologies to support the AB Nashville Headquarter opening.



The candidate will have internal and external training opportunities in both technical and leadership areas. The candidate will also have exposure to the business and other technology groups for future career opportunities.



(The ideal candidate should have the following):




Nashville, TN



AB is a leading global investment management firm that offers high-quality research and diversified investment services to institutional clients, individuals and private clients in major markets around the world. AB employs more than 500 investment professionals with expertise in growth equities, value equities, fixed income securities, blend strategies, and alternative investments, and, through its subsidiaries and joint ventures, operates in more than 20 countries. AB’s research disciplines include fundamental research, quantitative research, economic research and currency forecasting capabilities. Through its integrated global platform, AB is well-positioned to tailor investment solutions for its clients. AB also offers independent research, portfolio strategy and brokerage-related services to institutional investors.

Description:
Pacific Energy Concepts (PEC) helps businesses transform inefficient buildings into energy-saving workspaces. We are a growing company with North American operations in 50 states, and we are looking for a high performing COO / Integrator to become the strong #2 and support and achieve the strategic vision and company goals of our founder CEO. Could this be you?



Chief Operations Officer (COO)
Pacific Energy Concepts
210 W 3rd St,
Vancouver, WA 98660

Severin Sorensen,

sev@epraxis.com





Pacific Energy Concepts (PEC)) designs and installs cost-saving LED lighting solutions for commercial and industrial environments. PEC is one of North America’s leading providers of high performance, turn-key, LED lighting solutions. The company has delivered over $50MM in energy savings to some of the largest fortune 500 companies in the world. PEC is a specialist general contractor and has completed 7,000 projects in 50 states, from Puerto Rico, throughout United States and Canada. PEC’s core clientele are in the automotive, commercial, industrial, retail, manufacturing, and distribution sectors. Whether our customers are contemplating new construction, or a location retrofit, PEC’s lighting solutions provide highly energy efficient, aesthetically appealing customer experience improvements, and all this at an affordable cost. PEC achieves affordability for our customers through superior LED lighting system design, energy saving technology utilization, project installation management systems, and managing customer installation expense by leveraging energy industry incentives and offering affordable financing options. PEC is a highly entrepreneurial growing business that has made its reputation in the industry by listening-well to clients, and developing and delivering desired leading-edge energy-saving solutions for our customers.

With PEC’s industry focus and leading-edge energy solutions, PEC has grown rapidly over the past several years and is recognized today as one of the country’s fastest-growing companies by Inc Magazine. Our rapid growth requires continually building and strengthening our back office and support team to deliver on our brand promise and customer expectations. Consequently, PEC is looking for an outstanding Chief Operations Officer (COO) with been-there, done-that operations management experience to help us grow our people, systems, and processes to help our company get to the next level. PEC has asked ePraxis, a premier-level talent selection and executive coaching company, to coordinate its search for a new COO.

Our ideal candidate COO will have progressively responsible leadership positions with oversight over project management and/or construction-related operations, with supervision of project management of installations, procurement, IT, and office support staff for high growth industries. Further, if you have the ability to work with an enterprising millennial workforce and management team who are charged up about PEC mission and delivering great results, this may be the position for you. A detailed position description for the COO role follows.



The COO role as detailed herein is a new leadership position with Pacific Energy, and reports directly to the Pacific Energy CEO. The COO is one of several key members of the executive team including the CEO, VP Sales, etc. The COO is designated the second in command operationally and manages local and remote teams of approximately 60 FTEs or equivalents and subcontractors (2020 projected year-end). The COO is directly responsible for onsite management of corporate headquarters operations in Vancouver, WA, and manages operations of our remote offices in Dallas and Chicago, in addition to overseeing all installation operations nationally.



The COO reports to the company CEO of Pacific Energy Concepts, and is a key member of our Executive Team. Primary duties of the COO duties include:







Beyond the formal requirements traditionally expected of an COO, we are interested in finding an COO that meets our corporate culture and values, as “goodness of fit” is imperative for this key executive hire.

Motivations



Modes of Thinking



Modes of Acting



Modes of Interacting









PEC is a company led by a CEO and management team who are highly motivated millennial entrepreneurs that value winning, rewards, clarity, openness, candor, fun, and continual learning and growth. PEC company culture mantras include: build to last, push the envelope, play to win, and do the right thing. The company is moving to higher speeds as a progressive leader in the lighting and energy solutions marketplace and desires a COO to join that understands how to get the best results through people.



Salary is negotiable and commensurate with ability and experience. The benefits package is typical of other benefit packages for chief executives in Oregon.

The Director, Centers of Excellence (CoE) is located in the Federal Acquisition Service (FAS), Technology Transformation Services (TTS), Office of Clients and Markets, Centers of Excellence (CoE) Division and reports to the Assistant Commissioner, Clients and Markets. The Director, CoE directs all related CoE functions, providing high level support and consultative services to the Assistant Commissioner and managing and overseeing all products, platforms, and services that are provided by the CoE, TTS. Stakeholders and partners include high level contacts with the private sector and not-for-profit sectors where appropriate.

The CoE are established to implement, improve and expand public access to federal information services. To this end, the CoE work directly with customer agencies to identify their needs, recommend solutions, and identify the best contract vehicle to procure, support, and handle implementation of the solution. Each of the CoE is staffed with information technology (IT) experts who provide authoritative advice, experienced mentorship, and IT transformation services purposed to improve service design and customer interactions across major organizational federal government lines. Each of the CoE has a different mission and objectives, but all are intended to lead centralized, function­-specific talent, and ensure effective support for solution implementation. Currently there are six Centers: cloud adoption, IT infrastructure optimization, customer experience, contact centers, data analytics, and artificial intelligence; however, this number may increase based on market demand and growing IT modernization tools.

The Director, CoE manages and oversees high level functions performed by the CoE geared toward the implementation and establishment of major federal IT Modernization efforts and the establishment of the framework for the way the government builds, buys, and shares technology ensuring cost-effectiveness and efficiency. In this capacity serves as an expert, providing leadership, direction, and guidance and ensuring the implementation of major Federal, GSA, FAS, and TTS milestones, goals and commitments.

Represents GSA on major CoE activities and initiatives as related to federal IT Modernization efforts and implements programs to provide guidance on how to effectively and efficiently provide expert advice, consulting, development and support solution implementation within the following areas but not limited to: cloud adoption, IT infrastructure optimization, customer experience, contact centers, data analytics, artificial intelligence and related functions.

Supports the Assistant Commissioner, Clients and Markets and develops policies, plans and initiatives to ensure the effective growth and continual development of the CoE program, identifying barriers to achieving the desired change and developing an operational roadmap. Manages high level expectations, milestones, and strategies to ensure the success and excellence of the CoE. Identifies and executes on opportunities to cross-leverage other TTS and FAS capabilities and services in the CoE’s engagements with executive branch agencies.

Champions initiatives to support and lead the development of the CoE’s current and future value propositions within the federal government in an increasingly competitive marketplace and provides leadership and support to set the stage for innovative changes that are intended to benefit GSA and its stakeholders and partners. This includes change management initiatives geared toward refining the operational roadmap to maximize the CoE’s competitive advantage in a sustainable and deliberate manner.

Identifies and directs implementation of the myriad actions required to continually develop and improve the organization and operationalize new innovation initiatives, including not only potential programmatic changes, but also impact, communications, measurement & reporting, executive oversight, and risk management activities.

Develops a sustainable growth plan that provides an overarching view of the CoE today and also serves as a tool with which GSA, FAS, and TTS leadership can manage, measure and communicate progress as the CoE program evolves to respond to the changing needs of client agencies and the ever changing technology landscape.

Leads in a proactive, customer­ responsive manner consistent with the TTS, FAS and GSA’s vision and values. Ensures financial and managerial accountability by acting with prudence when executing fiduciary responsibilities. Demonstrates high integrity and adheres to the highest ethical standards of public service. Uses effective business practices, including balanced measures of results, and values and invests in each employee; emphasizes empowerment and two­ way communication. Takes a leadership role in advocating for and advancing the priorities of TTS, FAS, and GSA. Serves as a role model for leadership by encouraging teamwork and a collaborative approach.

These are uncertain times and perhaps you've become caught up in the uncertainty. Here at Gateway, we're feeling the same uncertainty.

I have started a networking/career counselling group that will not only offer job hunting advice, but also additional free tools to bring your job hunt to another level as well as help you keep sane by staying engaged in the job search.

If you're interested in more information, please drop me a note and I'll give you a broad overview of the format.

By way of an introduction I'll send you a handbook on how you can improve your online appearance and resume. If you are interested, I can also run a behavioral report about you, that will help detail your personality, how you prefer to manage, and how you prefer to be managed. You can add this report to your job applications, and I'll show you how to use that behavioral report to your advantage.

I've also uploaded some case studies that are recordings of virtual meetings to show you how you can apply your behavioral report to give any potential employers far greater insights in to not only your skills and experiences but what makes you tick. I look forward to connecting with you.

Again, I stress, it's free. I'm hoping to develop my network by offering you something that you can use right now because, candidly, most of my clients can't use our services right now!

The Director of eLearning is responsible for providing overarching leadership to the design, quality development, delivery, and assessment of courses offered in all distance delivery formats including fully online, hybrid (50% or more online), and blended (less than 50% online). The Director will evaluate, assess, and implement technology solutions to support instructional and support services for existing and emerging learning environments including developing metrics and tools to track student success and retention in online, hybrid, and blended courses. In addition, the Director will collaborate with faculty and support staff to ensure best practices in the delivery of eLearning courses and programs. This position has some teaching requirements.
Duties/Functions
Provide strategic, innovative leadership in the design, implementation, and continuous improvement of eLearning courses and related programs and services.
Responsible for ensuring eLearnings strategic alignment with GTCCs mission, vision, and goals and facilitates the preparation of both short- and long-term unit plans.
Provides leadership to the development and review of GTCCs online program and offerings.
Leads the effort to analyze distance education performance data/metrics, set goals for appropriate performance on each metric, and develop a plan to reach those goals.
Responsible for employee supervision and accountability, both direct and indirect reports, including recruitment, selection, orientation, scheduling, evaluation, coaching, rewards/recognition, and discipline.
Develop and effectively manage eLearnings budget. Prepare, monitor, control, and ensure spending within the budget allocation. Anticipate cost estimates for future needs.
Facilitate the college-wide eLearning Committee.
Work with faculty and staff in establishing documented policy and procedure for eLearning to be published in an eLearning handbook or manual.
Plan and execute efforts to incorporate new and innovative technologies into e-Learning courses/programs.
Develop and implement effective faculty certification programming and on-going professional development to ensure quality of instruction online.
Develop and implement key performance measures that evaluate the quality and effectiveness of support services for online faculty and students, identify potential gaps in services, and improve/increase utilization of services.

Lead the effort to assess and address student readiness for online learning with other stakeholders (e.g., faculty and Enrollment Management).
Develop effective outreach and communication campaigns to increase student awareness and engagement in eLearning support services.
Participate in national, regional and state professional development initiatives to improve knowledge and skill base.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Works with other eLearning Directors in North Carolina.

Location: New York City; Full Time.

CheckedUp is a healthcare media company, operating a dedicated network in doctors offices across the US. Our technology platform is deployed at the point of care, actively engaging patients and physicians in the waiting room, exam room and at home. As a health technology leader, CheckedUp aspires to create better educated and more confident patients and physicians who are empowered to make informed health decisions together.

Our team is driven by embracing technology to help bring innovative ideas, products, and services to help enhance and advance the health and wellbeing of people. Composed of leading physicians, strategists, mobile and web engineers and designers, our team is passionate about changing healthcare for the better. We take pride in what we’re doing, and it shows in our work ethic. Because we place a high value on initiative and personal growth, we’ve succeeded within our industry, and continue to push ourselves to create better healthcare experiences. In late 2018, CheckedUp placed #473 on the Inc. 5,000's list of the Fastest Growing Private Companies in the US.

The position offers an unparalleled opportunity for personal and financial growth, in a short period of time, in a supportive environment. We have a vibrant, diverse culture and are looking for the right person to join our scrappy team.







Salary for this position is competitive and depends on prior experience. A comprehensive benefits package is included.

COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY
CheckedUpencourages individuals of all ethnic and racial backgrounds toapplyfor this position. We are committed to maximizing the diversity of our organization.

Summary

Lead and define the market strategy and Business Development (BD) activities for CymSTAR LLC and CymSTAR Services LLC. Possess a thorough knowledge base in the US and FMS Military Simulation and Training Markets. Demonstrate a strong sales acumen, likable personality, and persuasive charisma in dealing with all levels of customer representatives.



Minimum of 10 years' experience in BD, Marketing & Sales management activities for US and FMS Military Simulation & Training related products and services.

Minimum of 10 years' experience and understanding of US military budgeting and acquisition processes.

Undergraduate degree in business, engineering or marketing. A graduate degree in marketing is preferred.

Experienced in both US and FMS Military Simulation & Training products and services with an appreciation of the sales and acquisition processes for both types of offerings and their unique characteristics. Aircrew Training Systems services experience is highly desired.

Maintains a highly visible personal profile and a strong professional reputation and network among US and FMS Military Training and Simulation customers and their representatives.

Track record of successful business development in the US and FMS Military Training and Simulation corporate and military accounts, both individually and as the leader of or major contributor to a team.

Experienced in the FMS & International marketplaces and therefore familiar with the nuances and complexities of selling to foreign governments and accounts.

Highly effective motivator and manager of people.

Individual with strong leadership abilities to build and motivate a strong-minded team of professionals.

Able to work well in a highly dynamic team-oriented environment.

Skilled business strategist and tactician, visionary with the skills to translate concepts and ideas into quantifiable results.

Businessperson with the ability to make sound business decisions in a highly competitive, fast moving environment.

Strong oral and written communication skills, with an ability to communicate effectively with a broad range of people including employees, customers and partners.

Confident, self-reliant, with a high degree of initiative and personal drive using a positive aggressive style.

"Hands-on" manager, comfortable with administrative tasks, who can work effectively in a Small Business company environment and with other Small or large company partners.

Creative, resourceful, and proactive finding new and innovative ways to penetrate markets and accounts.

Highly intelligent, combining strong technical skills with excellent marketing and sales abilities, strong strategic planning capabilities and good overall business acumen

Incumbent must either hold or be eligible for personal US DoD Security Clearance.

Ability to read, analyze, and interpret the military requirement documents and contracts.

Ability to respond effectively to the most sensitive inquiries and complaints.

Ability to generate effective oral and written presentations and proposals on complex subjects.

Ability to make effective and persuasive speeches and presentations on controversial or complex topics to customers at all levels from end users up to general level military office as well as company management.

An ability to interpret complex customer requirements and attitudes from verbal, non-verbal, and written communication. Ability to deal with a variety of abstract ideas.



Administrative supervision as described above.



Essential traits which must be possessed to be effective and successful.

Be able to interact socially with customer representatives at all levels of their organization, from executives to technicians and common laborers, while maintaining focus to gather intelligence necessary to provide CymSTAR with competitive advantages on specific opportunities, without violating governmental regulations, restrictions, or ethical practices.

Be able to identify/recognize customer product and service needs during interactions that even the customer may not be aware of and translate those to opportunities for CymSTAR.

Be likeable, attentive, and persuasive, without seeming arrogant, and be able to maintain control of personal emotions and indulgences in the most challenging of circumstances.

Possess sufficient technical skills/acumen to both (1) gain technical understanding of CymSTAR products and staff capabilities and (2) discuss technical requirements with customers, without being intimidated by customer or internal technical personnel.

Ability to comprehend and calculate ratios and percentages, Ability to comprehend and apply principles of modern algebra.

Able to consistently exercise rational discretion and judgment in performance of job. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, reason, and draw valid conclusions. U.S. Citizenship. Must be able to obtain a Secret Level Clearance

Experienced and proficient in the use of standard Personal Computer productivity software tools including word processors, spreadsheets, presentation graphics, project management, and databases.

Job Title: Senior Director, Sales Strategy and Profitability
Description:
Job Description

Lead a team of up to 30 Directors, Senior Advisors, Advisors, Analysts and external contractors. Responsible for driving CVS’ Sales and improve Profitability across the retail business. Provide fact-based and data-driven guidance to Category Managers in selecting vendors, brands, and SKUs that result in increased sales and profit. Responsible in using Pricing, Marketing, Product Promotions and improvements in Supply Chain to improve margin and/or drive sales. Responsible for providing thought leadership and overall guidance to team, by leveraging a keen understanding of CVS' product categories, vendor dynamics, assortment economics, retail strategy, negotiation strategy and tactics. Serve as thought partner to the Merchandising VPs and Sr. Directors during assortment reviews and vendor negotiations. Lead development of annual priorities such as sales and margin budgets, forecasts and annual plans by working with senior Merchandising leadership.
Lead team to identify sales growth, cost reduction, and profit improvement opportunities across SKUs and vendors through rigorous analysis and research, including: competitive benchmarking (space, brands, SKUs), market and customer insights (surveys, Extracare analysis), vendor insight (cost structures, motivations), and extensive SKU/brand/vendor-level analysis (relative productivity, profitability, brand loyalty, SKU transferability, pricing, promotions etc.). Analyze internal and external data sources to identify, refine and size potential growth opportunities. Identify, create, and develop new concepts/opportunities that are aligned to future state vision. Develop robust business cases to support and prioritize new concepts/opportunities. Develop presentations to communicate vision and concepts/opportunities to all levels of the organization. Engage & influence leaders across CVS functions to build alignment around retail strategy vision, design and implementation. Lead advanced analytics and data science team to deliver in retail/fast pace environments, using data to drive business decision making, mapping customer behavior and drivers of behaviors to buying behavior, and a hypothesis driven approach to analytics that can create structure. Manage team & oversee development of analytical materials to be shared internally during category reviews and assortment discussions with the Merchandising team. Manage team & oversee development of "Ask" materials to be shared with vendors during negotiations. Provide direct vendor negotiations support to Merchants, including serving as lead negotiator where needed. Manage processes to ensure that CVS is not receiving cost increases and that CVS receives cost decreases commensurate with commodity price drops. Manage team & oversee development of promotional and pricing plans to ensure CVS meets its aggressive financial targets on a weekly, monthly and annual basis. Partner with merchandising and vendors to develop differentiated promotion plans and events. Evolve our best-in-class promotion, pricing and merchandising effectiveness tools, analytics and reports to deliver incremental value to the business. Manage sourcing tools and processes (eg, RFPs, eAuctions) to ensure selection of best vendors for Store Brand and other commoditized products (considering cost, quality, value, availability, etc). Enhance and enforce documentation, archiving, and audit processes for agreements with vendors. Develop annual plans and budgets for category profit improvement, working with the Merchandising leadership team. Work on special projects, ad hoc analysis, and initiatives related to assortment performance and cost reduction and management. Successfully work on cross-enterprise and business-unit specific initiatives linked to company’s strategic imperatives. Successfully manage special projects that impact the entire organization and/or key business-unit partner, with a demonstrated experience in generating strategy or change initiatives. MUST APPLY BY 9/23/2020



Minimum Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or related field and 6 years of experience in Retail and Consulting, including 2 years of Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence. Must also have 2 years of experience in Predictive Analytics/Modelling; Tableau; SQL; Database Management; Teradata; and Oracle.



Please see required qualifications.


Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or related field. Please see required qualifications.

About Walmart.com

This Is That Place where opportunity knocks. Our Walmart eCommerce team is obsessed with finding ways to help our customers live better, raising the bar for an entire industry along the way. You’ll play a crucial role in shaping the future of shopping, working with crazy talented people in an environment that values kindness and transparency. With the energy of a startup and the scale of the Fortune One, it’s the ultimate innovator’s playground. Are you hungry to own your career and catapult ideas into action? Read on.



Walmart U.S. eCommerce Marketplace team is looking for a strong product leader to coordinate and lead the design and implementation for complex, cross-functional, and highly visible strategic return initiatives.

This leader will identify the critical performance indicators, business outcomes, and align the execution plans of all key stakeholders and teams to ensure the product achieves its desired goals. This leader will apply a general management perspective and problem-solving approach, will be agile and able to apply the right frameworks, operating cadence, and business analysis & acumen to the product roadmap. As such, this leader will be able to identify key risks, dependencies, and work with the requisite teams to put solutions in place that will achieve the product outcomes.

This Director of Product will be skilled at engaging and communicating to senior executives across multiple domains, as well as engaging at a detailed level across product management and engineering, strategy, merchant technology, retail merchandising, supply chain & analytics.

La Jolla Logic (LJL) is an advanced technology and information system security solutions firm founded in 2011 in San Diego, CA. LJL's mission is to pioneer innovative, high-quality and best value specialty technology and engineering services to customers in the federal government and commercial marketplace.

We are an SBA Certified 8(a) Woman-Owned Small Business, awarded San Diegos WOSB of the Year 2019 by the US SBA, and the SBA District Directors Technology Sector Award in 2018. LJL has a reputation for performance to the highest standard, specializing in high-end cybersecurity engineering solutions, to include Machine Learning Technology, Artificial Intelligence R&D, Secure Enterprise Architecture Design, Cross Domain Solutions (CDS) , DoD Cloud Architecture development and deployment (AWS, Azure), Structured Data Models and Inference Engine Technology, System Security Engineering and System Accreditations (RMF & DIACAP), Advanced Technology Concept Development and Feasibility Assessments, Information Systems Security Manager/Officer (ISSM/ISSO) Services, and NIST 800-171 Compliance.

LJL has an opening for a Director of Operations to join our team in San Diego. This senior management-level position requires versatility, strong intellect, initiative, top-flight communication skills, total reliability, and a pace and quality of execution consistent with our corporate culture. It also requires confidentiality, tact, and an ability to maintain a professional presence while handling multiple assignments within tight timeframes in a creative and dynamic environment. The ideal candidate is flexible, willing to learn, great at research, detail-oriented, predictive of risk, forward-thinking, adept at leading teams, and owns accountability for the accomplishment of major company goals. This position has many responsibilities and is perfect for the candidate who wishes to expand their leadership skills while managing the operation of a high-end boutique cybersecurity engineering firm servicing the commercial and Department of Defense (DoD) components.

Description:
Position Overview
Lead the maintenance and stewardship of the organization’s business systems and solutions
Develop operating procedures and risk management strategies for the organization’s business systems and solutions

Job # 546011

What You’ll Be Doing...

Design the core decisioning logic for real-time marketing decisioning platform based on business requirements; collaborate with marketing, business, channel, operations and technology application teams to understand the business requirements, user stories, business processes, business rules and data architecture then lead the design, development and configuration of the complete Pega decisioning logic architecture; assess decisioning platform capabilities, and create a roadmap for expansion in order to enable seamless omni-channel experience and personalized in-context customer interactions; architect the decisioning logic to execute customer centric marketing strategy across multiple channels and incorporate the customer life cycle stages executing Next Best Offer to influence customer interaction in every channel delivering a more relevant and personalized 1to1 customer experience; lead and own the implementation of decisioning enhancement roadmap by applying appropriate industry standards; create and evolve the Enterprise decisioning logic architecture which integrates seamlessly with complex technology landscape; design and configure rules and flows, and assist with the draft user interface and draft process flow development; map out and design the architecture for marketing strategies within Pega systems software and present to the concerning department; communicate technical concepts, problems, and solutions to technical and non-technical audiences; develop presentations to ensure the business strategy teams understand the technical aspects of the development that is being implemented; keep accurate record of materials used, expected deliverables, and milestones achieved; develop project plans to ensure the supervisor understands what is being accomplished and what is achievable; identify and mitigate existing business risks associated with solution architecture; ensure the solution architecture can accommodate future enhancements with ease.



Bachelor’s or foreign equivalent degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, Electrical or Electronic Engineering, or a related field followed by 6 years of progressive experience in developing software features using Pega, Java and J2EE, and collaborating with marketing, business, channel, operations and technology application teams. Experience therein to include 5 years working on Pega decisioning architecture, and Pega end to end implementation. Also requires Pega Decisioning Consultant certification.

Job Title: Executive Director, Massachusetts and the Northeast
Description:
Executive Director, Massachusetts and the Northeast

Organization Description
TechNet is the national, bipartisan network of technology CEOs and senior executives
that promotes the growth of the innovation economy.

TechNet's diverse membership includes dynamic startups and the most iconic
companies on the planet and represents over three million employees and countless
customers in the fields of information technology, e-commerce, the sharing and gig
economies, advanced energy, cybersecurity, venture capital, and finance. TechNet has
offices in Washington, D.C., Silicon Valley, San Francisco, Sacramento, Chicago,
Austin, Boston, Olympia, Albany, and Tallahassee.

Key Responsibilities
As TechNet's executive director for Massachusetts and the Northeast, you will develop
and manage TechNet operations in the Northeast region of the United States,
coordinating with TechNet members, TechNet's vice president of state policy and
politics, and other TechNet staff. The Northeast region includes Massachusetts,
Virginia, West Virginia, Maryland, Delaware, Pennsylvania, New Jersey, New York,
Connecticut, Rhode Island, Vermont, New Hampshire, and Maine.

Issue Advocacy: Advance and support TechNet's national and regional agendas by
working with TechNet members to develop and implement a regional policy and political
strategy. Lobby and advocate on behalf of TechNet's agenda before state legislatures.
Work closely, in a bipartisan fashion, with state legislators and their senior staff,
policymakers in the executive branch of state governments and at state regulatory
bodies, and TechNet members.

Government Affairs: Develop and maintain strong relationships with TechNet members,
legislative and constitutional leaders and their staffs, government entities, the press,
and trade associations.

Events: Plan and execute numerous events, such as one-on-one meetings, policy
roundtables, political fundraisers, lobby days, and large-scale events with policymakers,
technology industry leaders, and the press. This includes determining meeting format
and flow, scripting, talking points, and logistics.

Policy Analysis: Assist with the development and analysis of policy positions in
conjunction with TechNet staff and TechNet members. Organize and support member
working groups to determine policy positions, legislative strategies, and related
advocacy efforts. Develop subject matter expertise in key policy areas as determined.

Membership Development and Relations: Grow TechNet's membership through
retention and new member acquisition. This includes identifying prospective members,
making membership presentations, developing and implementing an issue-based
membership strategy, and organizing and executing an aggressive events and
relationship-building schedule designed to attract new members.



the Northeast legislatures. Political campaign and/or legislative experience
strongly desired. Trade association experience, technology industry experience,
and a strong background in advocacy are all a plus. J.D. preferred, but not
required.

A key member of the Commercial Leadership Team, the Senior Director, Commercial Operations leads and manages commercial functions including: sales operations, sales insights and analytics, sales reporting, market insights and analytics, commercial data management and strategy and incentive compensation. About CenturyLink

CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is the second largest U.S. communications provider to global enterprise customers. With customers in more than 60 countries and an intense focus on the customer experience, CenturyLink strives to be the world's best networking company by solving customers' increased demand for reliable and secure connections. The company also serves as its customers' trusted partner, helping them manage increased network and IT complexity and providing managed network and cyber security solutions that help protect their business.


We are looking for the best of the best sales professionals who will go to amazing lengths to solve the business problems of their clients by leveraging the IT solutions (IT platform, transformation and managed services) that we support within our IT Agility portfolio. CenturyLink's cloud and managed services arm is changing the way that large enterprises assess and procure the platform and services that keep them productive. We combine a significant local presence with an expansive global network and managed security services to keep our clients connected and secured, wherever business happens. The Sr Account Director demonstrates unique value by supporting our direct CenturyLink sales team with product and process expertise in our IT Agility offerings of cloud collaboration (Private Cloud, Public Cloud, Cloud Manager, Cloud Connect), Managed Hosting, Data Centers, SAP Ecosystem, Resiliency Services, Transition Management, Managed Services, Strategy and Systems Consulting.

Abt Associates seeks qualified candidates for the position of U.S. Strategic Partnerships Director. This position is located in the U.S. for the anticipated USAID-funded Africa Trade and Investment Program (ATIP). ATIP will advance Prosper Africa’s goals to boost trade, increase investment, and support business-friendly policy reforms. ATIP will work closely with U.S. partners and U.S. Embassy Deal Teams across Africa to identify and close deals. The program will complement the U.S. Government’s trade and investment tools through customized services – from business consulting and transaction facilitation to targeted policy interventions.

The program will have an office based in the Washington, D.C. area with regional offices supporting activities in West, East, and Southern Africa, and later North Africa. The program is a unique whole of government initiative, requiring coordination with USAID, Department of Commerce, State Department and others to complement the U.S. government’s trade and investment tools through regionally tailored services.



The U.S. Strategic Partnerships Director will lead ATIP activities to coordinate and work with networks of stakeholders and clients, including the private sector, U.S. and host government personnel and entities, civil society, other projects, and other related entities. This position is estimated to require approximately 25% travel internationally and domestically.

Position is contingent upon project award to Abt Associates.

Job Title: Head of Enterprise Risk Management and Internal Audit
Description:
Upstart is the leading AI lending platform partnering with banks to expand access to affordable credit. Forbes recently ranked Upstart #12 on its list of "most promising AI companies in America." Inc. Magazine also recognized Upstart as one of the Best Workplaces for 2020.

By leveraging Upstart's AI platform, Upstart-powered banks can have higher approval rates and lower loss rates, while simultaneously delivering the exceptional digital-first lending experience their customers demand. Upstart's patent-pending platform is the first to receive a no-action letter from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau related to fair lending. Upstart is based in San Mateo, California and Columbus, Ohio.

Most Upstarters join us because they connect with our mission of enabling access to effortless credit based on true risk. If you are energized by the impact you can make at Upstart, we'd love to hear from you!

As at Upstart, you are an experienced leader who will develop and lead our enterprise risk management (ERM) and internal audit programs. In this role you will bring a systematic and disciplined approach to the effectiveness of our risk management, audit, control, and governance processes. You will effectively identify, assess, monitor and report on the company's full range of enterprise risks and risk mitigation action steps. You will also be responsible for reviewing Upstart's financial and operational activities and performs advanced level professional internal auditing work. Your work will involve managing a comprehensive audit program including financial, credit, IT and compliance audit projects; consulting with Upstart's management and staff; developing the annual audit plan; and providing ongoing training, coaching and supervision to any internal audit staff hired. For success in this role, you'll bring a thorough knowledge of accounting, audit and risk management procedures, as well as keen business judgement. We're looking for an energized and motivated leader with a proven capability to develop strong working relationships with cross-functional partners and various levels of management throughout the company, including the board of directors. Your core competencies will include analytical, presentation, reporting, and organizational skills.













































Upstart is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer. We are dedicated to ensuring that underrepresented classes receive better access to affordable credit, and are just as committed to embracing diversity and inclusion in our hiring practices. We celebrate all cultures, backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences, and know that we can only become better together.

A&E Television Networks, LLC seeks a Director, Data Analytics & Integrations in New York, New York. This position is responsible for enterprise data architecture, business intelligence, data warehousing, meta data management, enterprise integration, DB modeling and DB design.



Specific duties include: designing, developing, deploying, maintaining, and enhancing the executive business socialization of data management and architecture, including DB design, physical design and modeling, as well as all aspects of enterprise business intelligence, data warehouse, and enterprise integration strategy; defining data management and governance best practices and standards to ensures consistent application of those practices across the organization; defining data and information architecture standards, policies and procedures for the organization, structure, attributes and nomenclature of data elements to apply accepted data content standards to technology projects; facilitating a consistent business analysis, data acquisition, access analysis and design, and Database Management Systems optimization to archive the recovery strategy, load strategy design and implementation, and manage the security and change at the enterprise level; leading the development and continuous enhancement of application vision and roadmap (both functional and technical) for data warehousing and BI solutions by aligning to business objectives; managing the development and applications of trends, value and utilization of data warehousing and BI applications to closely follows the evolution of business models and organizational priorities, and to ensures data assets are effectively managed across the enterprise; directing the modernization of analytic capabilities, processes and practices for the company to ensure that date is accurate; managing the development and implementation of capabilities to improve, monitor, and audit data quality within the reporting and analytics environment; leading one view of customer and content by providing flexible intelligent reporting and analytics platform risks appropriately to plan proactive mitigation.



Must have a Bachelor’s degree or foreign academic equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering or related field plus five (5) years of experience in the job offered or in an alternative occupation such as Software Engineer, Web Application Architect, or in a related business intelligence role.

Join the frontlines of today's healthcare transformation

We're seeking a Chief Information Security Officer to help us transform the way primary care is delivered and how patients are served.



VillageMD is changing the trajectory of healthcare. We’re empowering primary care physicians to make informed decisions, and engaging patients in meaningful ways. We work with thousands of clinicians and healthcare disruptors across the country, improving patient health while driving down the cost to deliver it.

We are a mission-oriented organization, and we are thrilled about the work that we accomplish every day. We’re transparent. Collaborative. Relentless in pursuit of our mission. With a confidence to lead but the humility to never stop learning. We believe that diverse backgrounds and experiences create the best opportunity for innovation. And we know that the community we are growing is greater than any one individual.

We’ve built our technology using the best of cloud and open-source technologies to create an open, data-first platform that is enriched with analytical models and connected to the most modern internal and external apps.

We’re creating an entirely new patient experience in which we’ve embedded our clinical model that is facilitated by connected medical devices, symptom checking, telehealth, messaging, and other features that allow patients to simply and easily connect with care teams, 24/7.



As the Chief Information Security Officer, you will be the executive security leader at VillageMD. You will be accountable for the security strategy, program development, and execution of security capability value creation and risk mitigation at the fastest growing leader in primary care in the US.

You will be stepping into an established security environment and embody the duality of both our security-first culture and pragmatic yet rapid development of capability as we embark to change healthcare for the better, every day.

As a hands-on practitioner, you will guide a strong team of security architects, operations, and risk managers across both our proprietary platform and apps and our corporate technology assets. You’ll regularly interface with senior leaders across the company as well as those in product, analytics, and engineering to ensure our security-first approach is seen, felt and proven in all that we do, all while accelerating value creation.



During your first year, you can expect the following professional challenges:
















As a successful VillageMD Chief Information Security Officer, you will bring:







In addition to competitive salaries, a 401k program with company match, bonus and a valuable health benefits package, VillageMD offers paid parental leave, pre-tax savings on commuter expenses, and generous paid time off. You work in a highly-collaborative, conscientious, forward-thinking environment that welcomes your experience and enables you to make a significant impact from Day 1. This fun, fast-paced, startup environment even comes complete with snacks.

You also have the flexibility to contribute remotely. Most importantly, you make a difference. You see a clear connection between your daily work on VillageMD products and services and the advancement of innovative solutions and improved quality of healthcare for providers and patients.

Job Title: Executive Director, Information Services (Citrix) Virtual Application Delivery
Description:
Description

THE ROLE

The Executive Director of Information Services (Citirx) Virtual Application Delivery will be based in one of the following locations: Portland OR, Renton, WA or Anaheim, CA. Will be responsible for delivering and managing the portfolio of deployment technologies for deploying virtualized applications across the enterprise. These services will be designed to provide measurable value to the business, producing increased operational efficiency, system reliability and availability, and strategic cost savings to the organization. The Executive Director will also be responsible for collaboratively evaluating, integrating, and maintaining enterprise-based Application Delivery Controllers into the PSJH environment. A core expectation will be to implement and maintain engineering standards and policies related to these emerging technologies.

The Executive Director will be responsible for managing both Operational and Engineering teams. These teams will leverage the technology portfolio to implement high valued, reliable, and scalable business solution. The Executive Director will be responsible for maintaining all standards of practice for the use of enterprise virtualized application delivery technologies. These standards will ensure proactive planning and forecasting measures are operationalized to manage business demand and exceed business expectations.

The Executive Director and teams will work collaboratively across TEO Service Lines in support of enterprise technology deployments, automation and innovation initiatives, and participate in re-engineering Virtualization Application Delivery solutions for existing technology issues across the enterprise. The Executive Director and teams are responsible for the automation of image deployment, including the monitoring and alerting involved in these systems. A core responsibility of this role

Additional core responsibilities include establishing and managing adherence to standards and polices, and build and support a professional, creative, and collaborative team. The Executive Director will maintain strategic vendor relationships, ensuring innovative strategies are incorporated into future roadmaps. The Executive Director and teams establish the standards for Virtualization Application Delivery Server configurations and ensure tools are available to monitor and remediate variances from the standards. High availability, security compliance, and disaster recovery of compute, and disaster recovery of compute and appliance resources is a responsibility of this Executive Director and requires close collaboration with the Cloud Engineering and Operations, Network Engineering & Operations, Caregiver Experience Engineering & Operations, and Information Security teams. The Executive Director of Virtual Application Delivery is responsible for the strategy and roadmap to provide automated build, deployment, and configuration of all Virtual Application Delivery hosts as well as the strategy and roadmap for enabling rapid growth in the Virtual Application environment and determining the evolution of application virtualization technologies to cloud-based products and services.



Core Responsibilities:







Operational Responsibilities













We service 65 thousand simultaneous users in our Citrix system where we provide load balancing for the data load. You will need to have previously worked in a cloud computing environment and need to understand the technical roadmap and nuances of the current state and how we will migrate over to the Azure cloud. The team needs to transform be able to operate in Azure in an automated dev-ops environment.

We have 4 to 5 projects going on simultaneously that are mix of each of our partner organizations. We are looking to streamline processes and synchronize them in order to work together.

You will help form the team into a very trusting and collaborative environment. There will be a complete refresh of the software environment with new HW, OS, SW etc. Majority of this work will happen in the Azure cloud.

Training will be vitally important and a formal plan and assessment process must be created, put into place and implemented for the team.

Operational readiness is of optimal importance so you will need to have strong Cirtix expertise.

Job Title: Sr. Director, Global Strategic Procurement Materials
Description:
Brambles companies, including CHEP, help move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organisation on earth. Our 330 million pallets, crates and containers are continuously in motion, forming the invisible backbone of the global supply chain and the world’s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, sustainably and safely. As pioneers of the sharing economy, Brambles created one of the world's most sustainable logistics businesses through the share and reuse of its platforms under a model known as ‘pooling’. Brambles primarily serves the fast-moving consumer goods (e.g. dry food, grocery, and health and personal care), fresh produce, beverage, retail and general manufacturing industries. The Group employs more than 10,000 people and operates in over 60 countries with its largest operations in North America and Western Europe. For further information, please visit www.brambles.com.

Join an award-winning company!

Who are we?

Job Title: Director & Technology Leader - Truman Medical Center
Description:
As a Director & Technology Leader, you will be responsible for managing the technical groups within ITWorks client sites, while ensuring all business standards and service levels are met. You will play a key leadership role in the organization, driving vision, strategy, planning, evaluation, design, development, and implementation of applications across clients that incorporate the site’s mission and vision. You will be responsible for the completion of annual financial planning, technology and security infrastructure assessments for the client as well as develop and enhance relationships with key client executives. As a leader of this team, you will contribute to and support the development of process improvements and evolution of the overall Cerner technology vision and strategy while managing the delivery of services and technology to clients to ensure that the client and business standards are achieved. Additionally, you will be responsible for contributing to the development of the overall solution roadmap and provide oversight of the implementation of operating procedures and direct the study, design and implementation of new systems and equipment. You are also responsible for ensuring infrastructure architecture meets standards, maximizes efficiency, supports platform compatibility, as well as identify and ensure mitigation of cross-functional impacts and areas of potential risk management. Finally, you will direct ownership and accountability in delivering organization objectives that cascade from corporate and client imperatives.
Your people management responsibilities will include seeking to understand disagreements, ensuring all perspectives are heard and facilitate a plan for resolution. You will delegate the work appropriately, provide clear expectations and follow up to ensure progress, overcome roadblocks and identify associates and team priorities based on business direction and adjust when needed. You are responsible for leading by example and share knowledge and experiences with associates and team creating a respectful work environment where you advocate for your team, create accountability and recognize their accomplishments. In addition, you will provide timely feedback to encourage success, ensure accountability, and connect opportunities for your associates’ development as well as identify the right talent to achieve the desired results. Finally, you will promote and build a diverse cohesive team to accomplish objectives and align associates’ skills to fill gaps.















Applicants for U.S. based positions with Cerner Corporation must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

Some Cerner positions may be obligated to comply with client-facing requirements and occupational health requests, including but not limited to, an immunization set, an annual flu shot, an annual TB screen, an updated background check, and/or an updated drug screen.

From single offices to entire countries, Cerner solutions are licensed at more than 25,000 facilities in over 35 countries.

Description:
This position will work closely with senior leadership to help design, develop and lead our company’s Learning and Staff Development function. He/she will act as a champion for the company’s training vision and programs.

Responsibilities

ID2020 is seeking an exceptional Chief Architect to join our leadership team and lead ID2020's market-shaping activities.

This is a full-time position. While we'd ideally love for this individual to join our San Francisco-based team,we are willing to consider exceptional candidates interested in remote work.



The ability to prove who you are is a basic human right and critical to a life of dignity and opportunity. But over 1 billion people, including over 230 million young children, are unable to prove their identity through any recognized means. As such, they are unable to access vital services, participate as a citizen or a voter, or transact in the modern economy.

There is increasing urgency, at many levels, to close this identity gap quickly, and by harnessing the power of information technology, address it digitally. But it is also plainly clear that digital ID, if not thoughtfully designed and carefully implemented, poses massive risk. And increased interest in closing the ID gap has, unfortunately, accelerated programs that pay little heed to privacy or user-management.

Founded in 2016, the ID2020 Alliance is a global partnership working to accelerate the adoption of user-managed, privacy-protecting and portable digital ID. We believe that sustained multi-stakeholder collaboration is vital to ensure that technology development is informed by the needs of countries and individuals and that programs and policies reflect recent technical innovations. And as a partnership of global organizations, we have a route to impact at a scale commensurate to the challenge.

Through our Certification and our consulting support to countries, companies and NGOs developing digital ID programs, ID2020's tech team is shaping the technical landscape to ensure that the digital ID solutions which are developed and adopted are user-managed, privacy-protecting and interoperable.

We have ambitious plans, and we know the most critical step is building an incredible team that brings fresh perspectives and a willingness to think outside the box. Our team is made up of people who both dream and do, and who infuse their work with a deep commitment to ID2020's mission and values, as articulated in the ID2020 Manifesto.



The Chief Architect will bring visionary, big-picture thinking, technical expertise, and a deep network across the digital ID ecosystem to lead ID2020's market-shaping work.

Reporting directly to the Executive Director, and part of a four-person executive team, the Chief Architect will:







You are a recognized technology leader, equally visionary and pragmatic. You have worked in and around the digital ID ecosystem, and have enough experience and insight to stretch beyond what is described in the job description above in order to accelerate ID2020's market-shaping work. At some point in your career, you may have run your own business or held an early, influential role in a rapidly-expanding start-up. You have:




To be successful, you will be highly autonomous, with strong problem-solving capabilities and a comfort switching between the big-picture and the tactical. You're adaptable and don't get bent out of shape easily, which will allow you to thrive in our fast-paced, dynamic environment.




Our online application will prompt you to submit a resume and cover letter. After you hit submit, here's what to expect:





We strive to build a team that reflects the diversity of the community we work in and encourage applications from traditionally underrepresented groups. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please send us a note.

These include the Defense Information Systems Agency the Departments of the Army, Health and Human Services, Homeland Security, Justice, State, and Treasury the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation the General Services Administration and several intelligence agencies. Pragmatics is proud of its ability to support our clients in achieving success in their important missions, and we look forward to continuing to provide them with the highest level of service. Our team is what makes Pragmatics great. At Pragmatics you'll work beside some of the smartest and most accomplished staff you'll find in your career. The successful Senior Director will lead the capture of new business awards through developing teams and solutions responsive to the customer needs, leveraging superior intelligence on existing work, teaming with the right partners, and proposing innovative and compelling solutions to meet customer requirements. The Senior Director should possess A Bachelor's Degree with at least 7 years of Government IT services related experience A proficiency in the MS Office Suite and possess excellent verbal, interpersonal, and written communication skills Proven skills in all areas of capture, including assessing win probability and value for opportunity targets, capture strategy and planning, building winning teams and solutions, pricing to win, and capture process schedule adherence Additional qualifications include Demonstrated record of federal agency client stewardship and capturebusiness development accomplishments Experience in business development activities associated with identification, qualification, full capture and bid activities, and the knowledge to transition new business opportunities into operations Experience in proposal pricing methodologies and strategies Experience in managing and contributing to winning proposal content Sound business ethics Excellent problem solving skills with ability to analyze situations, identify existing or potential problems and recommend solutions Experience with business development tools and resources such as GovWin or similar is preferred Capability to work as a collaborative team leader, as well as work within a team as a contributor ship Required with ability to obtain Secret level clearance Pragmatics is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer . Job Title: Director of Accessibility & Disability Services and Integrative Coach
Description:
Director of Accessibility & Disability Services and Integrative Coach

Dominican is located in Marin County, whose affluent and progressive reputation is juxtaposed with a reality of extreme economic and racial disparity. While the campus is situated in a privileged neighborhood, our institution has deep ties in surrounding neighborhoods where resources and representation for minoritized people are exceedingly disproportionate. Dominican is committed to improving our internal policies and practices related to equity and inclusion; it is also demonstrably engaged in collaborating with local, long-term community partners to improve equity and inclusion in Marin.

Our student body is remarkably diverse and we strive to see that diversity reflected in our faculty and staff. We seek candidates from all backgrounds who, through their research, teaching, work ethic, and service, will meaningfully contribute to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive campus and county.



here

Director of Accessibility & Disability Services/Integrative Coach

Student Success Center

Academic Affairs

Senior Director, Student Success Center

N/A

Exempt, Full-time



Dominican University of California is seeking an individual for a Director of Accessibility & Disability Services/Integrative Coach position.

Accessibility and Disability Services

The Director is responsible for interpretation and application of the regulations of Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, and University policies and provisions for accommodation of Dominican students with disabilities. The Director collaborates with other offices on campus, such as Academic departments, Admissions, Student Life, Housing, Information Technology, and Academic Affairs, to support students with disabilities in realizing their academic potential. Furthermore, the Director partners with other offices regarding campus access improvements.

Integrative Coaching




The Integrative Coach plays an active role in guiding and supporting students' experiences, paths toward success and their curricular and co-curricular choices. The bond between student and coach begins prior to students' arrival on campus, develops during New Student Orientation, grows in a first semester class, and remains critical throughout the students' career at the University. The Integrative Coach acts as a touchstone and “master mentor”, working with multiple student cohorts with the goal of supporting each student in maximizing their learning, engagement, and aspirations.



Accessibility and Disability Services 75%


Integrative Coaching 25%








Dominican University of California is an independent, international, learner-centered university, offering both undergraduate and graduate programs. Dominican has a 1:10 teacher-to-student ratio, an average class size of 16, with a small-town feeling in a park- like campus. We blend interdisciplinary core courses, real-world studies, and small classes with close and supportive academic advising and mentoring.



For further questions on the application process, please contact jobs@dominican.edu

Reporting to the Chief Risk Officer within the Risk Management and Information Security Department, this senior-level executive is responsible for establishing and maintaining Cboe’s global and comprehensive information security strategy and program to ensure our information assets and technologies are adequately protected. The CISO directs four teams (Engineering, Network Security Operations, Security Governance, and Security Operations) within the Information Security group that are responsible for identifying, developing, implementing, and maintaining processes, practices, and tools that mitigate information and technology risks throughout the global enterprise. The CISO leads incident response efforts and develops, maintains, and monitors compliance with information security-related policies, procedures, and controls. The CISO regularly provides reports regarding the status of the information security program to executive management, the CGM Board, the CGM Risk Committee, and subsidiary boards.







Whether you are just beginning your career or are a senior-level professional, working at Cboe will offer you countless opportunities to develop skills, make an impact through meaningful contributions, and gain rich experiences at an accelerated pace.
